#define LODEPNG_RESTRICT   /* not available */
 
#define LODEPNG_MAX(a, b)   (((a) > (b)) ? (a) : (b))
 
#define LODEPNG_MIN(a, b)   (((a) < (b)) ? (a) : (b))
 
#define LODEPNG_ABS(x)   ((x) < 0 ? -(x) : (x))

◆ WRITEBIT

#define WRITEBIT (   writer,
  bit 
)
Value:
{\
/* append new byte */\
if(((writer->bp) & 7u) == 0) {\
if(!ucvector_resize(writer->data, writer->data->size + 1)) return;\
writer->data->data[writer->data->size - 1] = 0;\
}\
(writer->data->data[writer->data->size - 1]) |= (bit << ((writer->bp) & 7u));\
++writer->bp;\
}

Definition at line 420 of file lodepng.cpp.

4318  {
4319  unsigned passw[7], passh[7];
4320  size_t filter_passstart[8], padded_passstart[8], passstart[8];
4321  unsigned i;
4322 
4323  Adam7_getpassvalues(passw, passh, filter_passstart, padded_passstart, passstart, w, h, bpp);
4324 
4325  if (bpp >= 8) {
4326  for (i = 0; i != 7; ++i) {
4327  unsigned x, y, b;
4328  size_t bytewidth = bpp / 8u;
4329  for (y = 0; y < passh[i]; ++y)
4330  for (x = 0; x < passw[i]; ++x) {
4331  size_t pixelinstart = passstart[i] + (y * passw[i] + x) * bytewidth;
4332  size_t pixeloutstart = ((ADAM7_IY[i] + (size_t)y * ADAM7_DY[i]) * (size_t)w
4333  + ADAM7_IX[i] + (size_t)x * ADAM7_DX[i]) * bytewidth;
4334  for (b = 0; b < bytewidth; ++b) {
4335  out[pixeloutstart + b] = in[pixelinstart + b];
4336  }
4337  }
4338  }
4339  }
4340  else /*bpp < 8: Adam7 with pixels < 8 bit is a bit trickier: with bit pointers*/ {
4341  for (i = 0; i != 7; ++i) {
4342  unsigned x, y, b;
4343  unsigned ilinebits = bpp * passw[i];
4344  unsigned olinebits = bpp * w;
4345  size_t obp, ibp; /*bit pointers (for out and in buffer)*/
4346  for (y = 0; y < passh[i]; ++y)
4347  for (x = 0; x < passw[i]; ++x) {
4348  ibp = (8 * passstart[i]) + (y * ilinebits + x * bpp);
4349  obp = (ADAM7_IY[i] + (size_t)y * ADAM7_DY[i]) * olinebits + (ADAM7_IX[i] + (size_t)x * ADAM7_DX[i]) * bpp;
4350  for (b = 0; b < bpp; ++b) {
4351  unsigned char bit = readBitFromReversedStream(&ibp, in);
4352  setBitOfReversedStream(&obp, out, bit);
4353  }
4354  }
4355  }
4356  }
4357 }

◆ Adam7_getpassvalues()

static void Adam7_getpassvalues ( unsigned  passw[7],
unsigned  passh[7],
size_t  filter_passstart[8],
size_t  padded_passstart[8],
size_t  passstart[8],
unsigned  w,
unsigned  h,
unsigned  bpp 
)
static

Definition at line 4079 of file lodepng.cpp.

4080  {
4081  /*the passstart values have 8 values: the 8th one indicates the byte after the end of the 7th (= last) pass*/
4082  unsigned i;
4083 
4084  /*calculate width and height in pixels of each pass*/
4085  for (i = 0; i != 7; ++i) {
4086  passw[i] = (w + ADAM7_DX[i] - ADAM7_IX[i] - 1) / ADAM7_DX[i];
4087  passh[i] = (h + ADAM7_DY[i] - ADAM7_IY[i] - 1) / ADAM7_DY[i];
4088  if (passw[i] == 0) passh[i] = 0;
4089  if (passh[i] == 0) passw[i] = 0;
4090  }
4091 
4092  filter_passstart[0] = padded_passstart[0] = passstart[0] = 0;
4093  for (i = 0; i != 7; ++i) {
4094  /*if passw[i] is 0, it's 0 bytes, not 1 (no filtertype-byte)*/
4095  filter_passstart[i + 1] = filter_passstart[i]
4096  + ((passw[i] && passh[i]) ? passh[i] * (1u + (passw[i] * bpp + 7u) / 8u) : 0);
4097  /*bits padded if needed to fill full byte at end of each scanline*/
4098  padded_passstart[i + 1] = padded_passstart[i] + passh[i] * ((passw[i] * bpp + 7u) / 8u);
4099  /*only padded at end of reduced image*/
4100  passstart[i + 1] = passstart[i] + (passh[i] * passw[i] * bpp + 7u) / 8u;
4101  }
4102 }

References ADAM7_DX, ADAM7_DY, ADAM7_IX, and ADAM7_IY.

Definition at line 3109 of file lodepng.cpp.

3109  {
3110  unsigned m = bits == 1 ? 7 : bits == 2 ? 3 : 1; /*8 / bits - 1*/
3111  /*p = the partial index in the byte, e.g. with 4 palettebits it is 0 for first half or 1 for second half*/
3112  unsigned p = index & m;
3113  in &= (1u << bits) - 1u; /*filter out any other bits of the input value*/
3114  in = in << (bits * (m - p));
3115  if (p == 0) out[index * bits / 8u] = in;
3116  else out[index * bits / 8u] |= in;
3117 }

1477  {
1478  /*values in encoded vector are those used by deflate:
1479  0-255: literal bytes
1480  256: end
1481  257-285: length/distance pair (length code, followed by extra length bits, distance code, extra distance bits)

3986  unsigned bits = stats->bits;
3987 
3988  mode_out->key_defined = 0;
3989 
3990  if (key && numpixels <= 16) {
3991  alpha = 1; /*too few pixels to justify tRNS chunk overhead*/
3992  key = 0;
3993  if (bits < 8) bits = 8; /*PNG has no alphachannel modes with less than 8-bit per channel*/
3994  }
3995 
3996  gray_ok = !stats->colored;
3997  if (!stats->allow_greyscale) gray_ok = 0;
3998  if (!gray_ok && bits < 8) bits = 8;
3999 
4000  n = stats->numcolors;
4001  palettebits = n <= 2 ? 1 : (n <= 4 ? 2 : (n <= 16 ? 4 : 8));
4002  palette_ok = n <= 256 && bits <= 8 && n != 0; /*n==0 means likely numcolors wasn't computed*/
4003  if (numpixels < n * 2) palette_ok = 0; /*don't add palette overhead if image has only a few pixels*/
4004  if (gray_ok && !alpha && bits <= palettebits) palette_ok = 0; /*gray is less overhead*/
4005  if (!stats->allow_palette) palette_ok = 0;
4006 
4007  if (palette_ok) {
4008  const unsigned char* p = stats->palette;
4009  lodepng_palette_clear(mode_out); /*remove potential earlier palette*/
4010  for (i = 0; i != stats->numcolors; ++i) {
4011  error = lodepng_palette_add(mode_out, p[i * 4 + 0], p[i * 4 + 1], p[i * 4 + 2], p[i * 4 + 3]);
4012  if (error) break;
4013  }
4014 
4015  mode_out->colortype = LCT_PALETTE;
4016  mode_out->bitdepth = palettebits;
4017 
4018  if (mode_in->colortype == LCT_PALETTE && mode_in->palettesize >= mode_out->palettesize
4019  && mode_in->bitdepth == mode_out->bitdepth) {
4020  /*If input should have same palette colors, keep original to preserve its order and prevent conversion*/
4021  lodepng_color_mode_cleanup(mode_out);
4022  lodepng_color_mode_copy(mode_out, mode_in);
4023  }
4024  }
4025  else /*8-bit or 16-bit per channel*/ {
4026  mode_out->bitdepth = bits;
4027  mode_out->colortype = alpha ? (gray_ok ? LCT_GREY_ALPHA : LCT_RGBA)
4028  : (gray_ok ? LCT_GREY : LCT_RGB);
4029  if (key) {
4030  unsigned mask = (1u << mode_out->bitdepth) - 1u; /*stats always uses 16-bit, mask converts it*/
4031  mode_out->key_r = stats->key_r & mask;
4032  mode_out->key_g = stats->key_g & mask;
4033  mode_out->key_b = stats->key_b & mask;
4034  mode_out->key_defined = 1;
4035  }
4036  }
4037 
4038  return error;
4039 }

static void boundaryPM ( BPMLists *  lists,

size_t  numpresent,

)

Definition at line 948 of file lodepng.cpp.

948  {
949  unsigned lastindex = lists->chains1[c]->index;
950 
951  if (c == 0) {
952  if (lastindex >= numpresent) return;
953  lists->chains0[c] = lists->chains1[c];
954  lists->chains1[c] = bpmnode_create(lists, leaves[lastindex].weight, lastindex + 1, 0);
955  }
956  else {
957  /*sum of the weights of the head nodes of the previous lookahead chains.*/
958  int sum = lists->chains0[c - 1]->weight + lists->chains1[c - 1]->weight;
959  lists->chains0[c] = lists->chains1[c];
960  if (lastindex < numpresent && sum > leaves[lastindex].weight) {
961  lists->chains1[c] = bpmnode_create(lists, leaves[lastindex].weight, lastindex + 1, lists->chains1[c]->tail);
962  return;
963  }
964  lists->chains1[c] = bpmnode_create(lists, sum, lastindex, lists->chains1[c - 1]);
965  /*in the end we are only interested in the chain of the last list, so no
966  need to recurse if we're at the last one (this gives measurable speedup)*/
967  if (num + 1 < (int)(2 * numpresent - 2)) {
968  boundaryPM(lists, leaves, numpresent, c - 1, num);
969  boundaryPM(lists, leaves, numpresent, c - 1, num);
970  }
971  }
972 }

926  BPMNode* mem = (BPMNode*)lodepng_malloc(sizeof(*leaves) * num);
927  size_t width, counter = 0;
928  for (width = 1; width < num; width *= 2) {
929  BPMNode* a = (counter & 1) ? mem : leaves;
930  BPMNode* b = (counter & 1) ? leaves : mem;
931  size_t p;
932  for (p = 0; p < num; p += 2 * width) {
933  size_t q = (p + width > num) ? num : (p + width);
934  size_t r = (p + 2 * width > num) ? num : (p + 2 * width);
935  size_t i = p, j = q, k;
936  for (k = p; k < r; k++) {
937  if (i < q && (j >= r || a[i].weight <= a[j].weight)) b[k] = a[i++];
938  else b[k] = a[j++];
939  }
940  }
941  counter++;
942  }
943  if (counter & 1) lodepng_memcpy(leaves, mem, sizeof(*leaves) * num);
944  lodepng_free(mem);
945 }

4865  CERROR_RETURN(state->error, 92); /*overflow possible due to amount of pixels*/
4866  }
4867 
4868  /*the input filesize is a safe upper bound for the sum of idat chunks size*/
4869  idat = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(insize);
4870  if (!idat) CERROR_RETURN(state->error, 83); /*alloc fail*/

4873

4875  IDAT data is put at the start of the in buffer*/
4876  while (!IEND && !state->error) {
4877  unsigned chunkLength;
4878  const unsigned char* data; /*the data in the chunk*/
4879 
4880  /*error: size of the in buffer too small to contain next chunk*/
4881  if ((size_t)((chunk - in) + 12) > insize || chunk < in) {
4882  if (state->decoder.ignore_end) break; /*other errors may still happen though*/
4883  CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 30);
4884  }
4885

4888  /*error: chunk length larger than the max PNG chunk size*/

4890  if (state->decoder.ignore_end) break; /*other errors may still happen though*/

4892  }
4893

4895  CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 64); /*error: size of the in buffer too small to contain next chunk*/
4896  }
4897 
4898  data = lodepng_chunk_data_const(chunk);
4899 
4900  unknown = 0;
4901 
4902  /*IDAT chunk, containing compressed image data*/
4903  if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "IDAT")) {
4904  size_t newsize;
4905  if (lodepng_addofl(idatsize, chunkLength, &newsize)) CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 95);
4906  if (newsize > insize) CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 95);
4907  lodepng_memcpy(idat + idatsize, data, chunkLength);
4908  idatsize += chunkLength;
4909 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
4910  critical_pos = 3;
4911 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
4912  }
4913  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "IEND")) {
4914  /*IEND chunk*/
4915  IEND = 1;
4916  }
4917  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "PLTE")) {
4918  /*palette chunk (PLTE)*/
4919  state->error = readChunk_PLTE(&state->info_png.color, data, chunkLength);
4920  if (state->error) break;
4921 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
4922  critical_pos = 2;
4923 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
4924  }
4925  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "tRNS")) {
4926  /*palette transparency chunk (tRNS). Even though this one is an ancillary chunk , it is still compiled
4927  in without 'LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS' because it contains essential color information that
4928  affects the alpha channel of pixels. */
4929  state->error = readChunk_tRNS(&state->info_png.color, data, chunkLength);
4930  if (state->error) break;
4931 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
4932  /*background color chunk (bKGD)*/
4933  }
4934  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "bKGD")) {
4935  state->error = readChunk_bKGD(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4936  if (state->error) break;
4937  }
4938  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "tEXt")) {
4939  /*text chunk (tEXt)*/
4940  if (state->decoder.read_text_chunks) {
4941  state->error = readChunk_tEXt(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4942  if (state->error) break;
4943  }
4944  }
4945  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "zTXt")) {
4946  /*compressed text chunk (zTXt)*/
4947  if (state->decoder.read_text_chunks) {
4948  state->error = readChunk_zTXt(&state->info_png, &state->decoder.zlibsettings, data, chunkLength);
4949  if (state->error) break;
4950  }
4951  }
4952  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "iTXt")) {
4953  /*international text chunk (iTXt)*/
4954  if (state->decoder.read_text_chunks) {
4955  state->error = readChunk_iTXt(&state->info_png, &state->decoder.zlibsettings, data, chunkLength);
4956  if (state->error) break;
4957  }
4958  }
4959  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "tIME")) {
4960  state->error = readChunk_tIME(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4961  if (state->error) break;
4962  }

4964  state->error = readChunk_pHYs(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4965  if (state->error) break;
4966  }

4968  state->error = readChunk_gAMA(&state->info_png, data, chunkLength);
4969  if (state->error) break;
4970  }
4971  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "cHRM")) {

4973  if (state->error) break;
4974  }

4977  if (state->error) break;
4978  }
4979  else if (lodepng_chunk_type_equals(chunk, "iCCP")) {
4980  state->error = readChunk_iCCP(&state->info_png, &state->decoder.zlibsettings, data, chunkLength);
4981  if (state->error) break;
4982 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
4983  }
4984  else /*it's not an implemented chunk type, so ignore it: skip over the data*/ {
4985  /*error: unknown critical chunk (5th bit of first byte of chunk type is 0)*/
4986  if (!state->decoder.ignore_critical && !lodepng_chunk_ancillary(chunk)) {
4987  CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 69);
4988  }
4989 
4990  unknown = 1;
4991 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
4992  if (state->decoder.remember_unknown_chunks) {
4993  state->error = lodepng_chunk_append(&state->info_png.unknown_chunks_data[critical_pos - 1],
4994  &state->info_png.unknown_chunks_size[critical_pos - 1], chunk);
4995  if (state->error) break;
4996  }
4997 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
4998  }
4999 
5000  if (!state->decoder.ignore_crc && !unknown) /*check CRC if wanted, only on known chunk types*/ {
5001  if (lodepng_chunk_check_crc(chunk)) CERROR_BREAK(state->error, 57); /*invalid CRC*/
5002  }
5003 
5004  if (!IEND) chunk = lodepng_chunk_next_const(chunk, in + insize);
5005  }
5006 
5007  if (state->info_png.color.colortype == LCT_PALETTE && !state->info_png.color.palette) {
5008  state->error = 106; /* error: PNG file must have PLTE chunk if color type is palette */
5009  }
5010 
5011  if (!state->error) {
5012  /*predict output size, to allocate exact size for output buffer to avoid more dynamic allocation.
5013  If the decompressed size does not match the prediction, the image must be corrupt.*/
5014  if (state->info_png.interlace_method == 0) {
5015  size_t bpp = lodepng_get_bpp(&state->info_png.color);
5016  expected_size = lodepng_get_raw_size_idat(*w, *h, bpp);
5017  }
5018  else {
5019  size_t bpp = lodepng_get_bpp(&state->info_png.color);
5020  /*Adam-7 interlaced: expected size is the sum of the 7 sub-images sizes*/
5021  expected_size = 0;
5022  expected_size += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 7) >> 3, (*h + 7) >> 3, bpp);
5023  if (*w > 4) expected_size += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 3) >> 3, (*h + 7) >> 3, bpp);
5024  expected_size += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 3) >> 2, (*h + 3) >> 3, bpp);
5025  if (*w > 2) expected_size += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 1) >> 2, (*h + 3) >> 2, bpp);
5026  expected_size += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 1) >> 1, (*h + 1) >> 2, bpp);
5027  if (*w > 1) expected_size += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 0) >> 1, (*h + 1) >> 1, bpp);
5028  expected_size += lodepng_get_raw_size_idat((*w + 0), (*h + 0) >> 1, bpp);
5029  }
5030 
5031  state->error = zlib_decompress(&scanlines, &scanlines_size, expected_size, idat, idatsize, &state->decoder.zlibsettings);
5032  }
5033  if (!state->error && scanlines_size != expected_size) state->error = 91; /*decompressed size doesn't match prediction*/
5034  lodepng_free(idat);
5035 
5036  if (!state->error) {
5037  outsize = lodepng_get_raw_size(*w, *h, &state->info_png.color);
5038  *out = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(outsize);
5039  if (!*out) state->error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5040  }
5041  if (!state->error) {
5042  lodepng_memset(*out, 0, outsize);
5043  state->error = postProcessScanlines(*out, scanlines, *w, *h, &state->info_png);
5044  }
5045  lodepng_free(scanlines);
5046 }

References lodepng_addofl(), lodepng_chunk_ancillary(), lodepng_chunk_append(), lodepng_chunk_check_crc(), lodepng_chunk_data_const(), lodepng_chunk_length(), lodepng_chunk_next_const(), lodepng_chunk_type_equals(), lodepng_free(), lodepng_get_bpp(), lodepng_get_raw_size(), lodepng_get_raw_size_idat(), lodepng_inspect(), lodepng_malloc(), lodepng_memcpy(), lodepng_memset(), lodepng_pixel_overflow(), postProcessScanlines(), readChunk_bKGD(), readChunk_cHRM(), readChunk_gAMA(), readChunk_iCCP(), readChunk_iTXt(), readChunk_pHYs(), readChunk_PLTE(), readChunk_sRGB(), readChunk_tEXt(), readChunk_tIME(), readChunk_tRNS(), readChunk_zTXt(), and zlib_decompress().

◆ deflateDynamic()

static unsigned deflateDynamic ( LodePNGBitWriter *  writer,
Hash *  hash,
const unsigned char *  data,
size_t  datapos,
size_t  dataend,
const LodePNGCompressSettings *  settings,
unsigned  final

Definition at line 1825 of file lodepng.cpp.

1827  {
1828  unsigned error = 0;
1829 
1830  /*
1831  A block is compressed as follows: The PNG data is lz77 encoded, resulting in
1832  literal bytes and length/distance pairs. This is then huffman compressed with
1833  two huffman trees. One huffman tree is used for the lit and len values ("ll"),
1834  another huffman tree is used for the dist values ("d"). These two trees are
1835  stored using their code lengths, and to compress even more these code lengths
1836  are also run-length encoded and huffman compressed. This gives a huffman tree
1837  of code lengths "cl". The code lengths used to describe this third tree are
1838  the code length code lengths ("clcl").
1839  */
1840 
1841  /*The lz77 encoded data, represented with integers since there will also be length and distance codes in it*/
1842  uivector lz77_encoded;
1843  HuffmanTree tree_ll; /*tree for lit,len values*/
1844  HuffmanTree tree_d; /*tree for distance codes*/
1845  HuffmanTree tree_cl; /*tree for encoding the code lengths representing tree_ll and tree_d*/
1846  unsigned* frequencies_ll = 0; /*frequency of lit,len codes*/
1847  unsigned* frequencies_d = 0; /*frequency of dist codes*/
1848  unsigned* frequencies_cl = 0; /*frequency of code length codes*/
1849  unsigned* bitlen_lld = 0; /*lit,len,dist code lengths (int bits), literally (without repeat codes).*/
1850  unsigned* bitlen_lld_e = 0; /*bitlen_lld encoded with repeat codes (this is a rudimentary run length compression)*/
1851  size_t datasize = dataend - datapos;
1852 
1853  /*
1854  If we could call "bitlen_cl" the the code length code lengths ("clcl"), that is the bit lengths of codes to represent
1855  tree_cl in CLCL_ORDER, then due to the huffman compression of huffman tree representations ("two levels"), there are
1856  some analogies:
1857  bitlen_lld is to tree_cl what data is to tree_ll and tree_d.
1858  bitlen_lld_e is to bitlen_lld what lz77_encoded is to data.
1859  bitlen_cl is to bitlen_lld_e what bitlen_lld is to lz77_encoded.
1860  */
1861 
1862  unsigned BFINAL = final;
1863  size_t i;
1864  size_t numcodes_ll, numcodes_d, numcodes_lld, numcodes_lld_e, numcodes_cl;
1865  unsigned HLIT, HDIST, HCLEN;
1866 
1867  uivector_init(&lz77_encoded);
1868  HuffmanTree_init(&tree_ll);
1869  HuffmanTree_init(&tree_d);
1870  HuffmanTree_init(&tree_cl);
1871  /* could fit on stack, but >1KB is on the larger side so allocate instead */
1872  frequencies_ll = (unsigned*)lodepng_malloc(286 * sizeof(*frequencies_ll));
1873  frequencies_d = (unsigned*)lodepng_malloc(30 * sizeof(*frequencies_d));
1874  frequencies_cl = (unsigned*)lodepng_malloc(NUM_CODE_LENGTH_CODES * sizeof(*frequencies_cl));
1875 
1876  if (!frequencies_ll || !frequencies_d || !frequencies_cl) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
1877 
1878  /*This while loop never loops due to a break at the end, it is here to
1879  allow breaking out of it to the cleanup phase on error conditions.*/
1880  while (!error) {
1881  lodepng_memset(frequencies_ll, 0, 286 * sizeof(*frequencies_ll));
1882  lodepng_memset(frequencies_d, 0, 30 * sizeof(*frequencies_d));
1883  lodepng_memset(frequencies_cl, 0, NUM_CODE_LENGTH_CODES * sizeof(*frequencies_cl));
1884 
1885  if (settings->use_lz77) {
1886  error = encodeLZ77(&lz77_encoded, hash, data, datapos, dataend, settings->windowsize,
1887  settings->minmatch, settings->nicematch, settings->lazymatching);
1888  if (error) break;
1889  }
1890  else {
1891  if (!uivector_resize(&lz77_encoded, datasize)) ERROR_BREAK(83 /*alloc fail*/);
1892  for (i = datapos; i < dataend; ++i) lz77_encoded.data[i - datapos] = data[i]; /*no LZ77, but still will be Huffman compressed*/
1893  }
1894 
1895  /*Count the frequencies of lit, len and dist codes*/
1896  for (i = 0; i != lz77_encoded.size; ++i) {
1897  unsigned symbol = lz77_encoded.data[i];
1898  ++frequencies_ll[symbol];
1899  if (symbol > 256) {
1900  unsigned dist = lz77_encoded.data[i + 2];
1901  ++frequencies_d[dist];
1902  i += 3;
1903  }
1904  }
1905  frequencies_ll[256] = 1; /*there will be exactly 1 end code, at the end of the block*/
1906 
1907  /*Make both huffman trees, one for the lit and len codes, one for the dist codes*/
1908  error = HuffmanTree_makeFromFrequencies(&tree_ll, frequencies_ll, 257, 286, 15);
1909  if (error) break;
1910  /*2, not 1, is chosen for mincodes: some buggy PNG decoders require at least 2 symbols in the dist tree*/
1911  error = HuffmanTree_makeFromFrequencies(&tree_d, frequencies_d, 2, 30, 15);
1912  if (error) break;
1913 
1914  numcodes_ll = LODEPNG_MIN(tree_ll.numcodes, 286);
1915  numcodes_d = LODEPNG_MIN(tree_d.numcodes, 30);
1916  /*store the code lengths of both generated trees in bitlen_lld*/
1917  numcodes_lld = numcodes_ll + numcodes_d;
1918  bitlen_lld = (unsigned*)lodepng_malloc(numcodes_lld * sizeof(*bitlen_lld));
1919  /*numcodes_lld_e never needs more size than bitlen_lld*/
1920  bitlen_lld_e = (unsigned*)lodepng_malloc(numcodes_lld * sizeof(*bitlen_lld_e));
1921  if (!bitlen_lld || !bitlen_lld_e) ERROR_BREAK(83); /*alloc fail*/
1922  numcodes_lld_e = 0;
1923 
1924  for (i = 0; i != numcodes_ll; ++i) bitlen_lld[i] = tree_ll.lengths[i];
1925  for (i = 0; i != numcodes_d; ++i) bitlen_lld[numcodes_ll + i] = tree_d.lengths[i];
1926 
1927  /*run-length compress bitlen_ldd into bitlen_lld_e by using repeat codes 16 (copy length 3-6 times),
1928  17 (3-10 zeroes), 18 (11-138 zeroes)*/
1929  for (i = 0; i != numcodes_lld; ++i) {
1930  unsigned j = 0; /*amount of repetitions*/
1931  while (i + j + 1 < numcodes_lld && bitlen_lld[i + j + 1] == bitlen_lld[i]) ++j;
1932 
1933  if (bitlen_lld[i] == 0 && j >= 2) /*repeat code for zeroes*/ {
1934  ++j; /*include the first zero*/
1935  if (j <= 10) /*repeat code 17 supports max 10 zeroes*/ {
1936  bitlen_lld_e[numcodes_lld_e++] = 17;
1937  bitlen_lld_e[numcodes_lld_e++] = j - 3;
1938  }
1939  else /*repeat code 18 supports max 138 zeroes*/ {
1940  if (j > 138) j = 138;
1941  bitlen_lld_e[numcodes_lld_e++] = 18;
1942  bitlen_lld_e[numcodes_lld_e++] = j - 11;
1943  }
1944  i += (j - 1);
1945  }
1946  else if (j >= 3) /*repeat code for value other than zero*/ {
1947  size_t k;
1948  unsigned num = j / 6u, rest = j % 6u;
1949  bitlen_lld_e[numcodes_lld_e++] = bitlen_lld[i];
1950  for (k = 0; k < num; ++k) {
1951  bitlen_lld_e[numcodes_lld_e++] = 16;
1952  bitlen_lld_e[numcodes_lld_e++] = 6 - 3;
1953  }
1954  if (rest >= 3) {
1955  bitlen_lld_e[numcodes_lld_e++] = 16;
1956  bitlen_lld_e[numcodes_lld_e++] = rest - 3;
1957  }
1958  else j -= rest;
1959  i += j;
1960  }
1961  else /*too short to benefit from repeat code*/ {
1962  bitlen_lld_e[numcodes_lld_e++] = bitlen_lld[i];
1963  }
1964  }
1965 
1966  /*generate tree_cl, the huffmantree of huffmantrees*/
1967  for (i = 0; i != numcodes_lld_e; ++i) {
1968  ++frequencies_cl[bitlen_lld_e[i]];
1969  /*after a repeat code come the bits that specify the number of repetitions,
1970  those don't need to be in the frequencies_cl calculation*/
1971  if (bitlen_lld_e[i] >= 16) ++i;
1972  }
1973 
1974  error = HuffmanTree_makeFromFrequencies(&tree_cl, frequencies_cl,
1975  NUM_CODE_LENGTH_CODES, NUM_CODE_LENGTH_CODES, 7);
1976  if (error) break;
1977 
1978  /*compute amount of code-length-code-lengths to output*/
1979  numcodes_cl = NUM_CODE_LENGTH_CODES;
1980  /*trim zeros at the end (using CLCL_ORDER), but minimum size must be 4 (see HCLEN below)*/
1981  while (numcodes_cl > 4u && tree_cl.lengths[CLCL_ORDER[numcodes_cl - 1u]] == 0) {
1982  numcodes_cl--;
1983  }
1984 
1985  /*
1986  Write everything into the output
1987 
1988  After the BFINAL and BTYPE, the dynamic block consists out of the following:
1989  - 5 bits HLIT, 5 bits HDIST, 4 bits HCLEN
1990  - (HCLEN+4)*3 bits code lengths of code length alphabet
1991  - HLIT + 257 code lengths of lit/length alphabet (encoded using the code length
1992  alphabet, + possible repetition codes 16, 17, 18)
1993  - HDIST + 1 code lengths of distance alphabet (encoded using the code length
1994  alphabet, + possible repetition codes 16, 17, 18)
1995  - compressed data
1996  - 256 (end code)
1997  */
1998 
1999  /*Write block type*/
2000  writeBits(writer, BFINAL, 1);
2001  writeBits(writer, 0, 1); /*first bit of BTYPE "dynamic"*/
2002  writeBits(writer, 1, 1); /*second bit of BTYPE "dynamic"*/
2003 
2004  /*write the HLIT, HDIST and HCLEN values*/
2005  /*all three sizes take trimmed ending zeroes into account, done either by HuffmanTree_makeFromFrequencies
2006  or in the loop for numcodes_cl above, which saves space. */
2007  HLIT = (unsigned)(numcodes_ll - 257);
2008  HDIST = (unsigned)(numcodes_d - 1);
2009  HCLEN = (unsigned)(numcodes_cl - 4);
2010  writeBits(writer, HLIT, 5);
2011  writeBits(writer, HDIST, 5);
2012  writeBits(writer, HCLEN, 4);
2013 
2014  /*write the code lengths of the code length alphabet ("bitlen_cl")*/
2015  for (i = 0; i != numcodes_cl; ++i) writeBits(writer, tree_cl.lengths[CLCL_ORDER[i]], 3);
2016 
2017  /*write the lengths of the lit/len AND the dist alphabet*/
2018  for (i = 0; i != numcodes_lld_e; ++i) {
2019  writeBitsReversed(writer, tree_cl.codes[bitlen_lld_e[i]], tree_cl.lengths[bitlen_lld_e[i]]);
2020  /*extra bits of repeat codes*/
2021  if (bitlen_lld_e[i] == 16) writeBits(writer, bitlen_lld_e[++i], 2);
2022  else if (bitlen_lld_e[i] == 17) writeBits(writer, bitlen_lld_e[++i], 3);
2023  else if (bitlen_lld_e[i] == 18) writeBits(writer, bitlen_lld_e[++i], 7);
2024  }
2025 
2026  /*write the compressed data symbols*/
2027  writeLZ77data(writer, &lz77_encoded, &tree_ll, &tree_d);
2028  /*error: the length of the end code 256 must be larger than 0*/
2029  if (tree_ll.lengths[256] == 0) ERROR_BREAK(64);
2030 
2031  /*write the end code*/
2032  writeBitsReversed(writer, tree_ll.codes[256], tree_ll.lengths[256]);
2033 
2034  break; /*end of error-while*/
2035  }
2036 
2037  /*cleanup*/
2038  uivector_cleanup(&lz77_encoded);
2039  HuffmanTree_cleanup(&tree_ll);
2040  HuffmanTree_cleanup(&tree_d);
2041  HuffmanTree_cleanup(&tree_cl);
2042  lodepng_free(frequencies_ll);
2043  lodepng_free(frequencies_d);
2044  lodepng_free(frequencies_cl);
2045  lodepng_free(bitlen_lld);
2046  lodepng_free(bitlen_lld_e);
2047 
2048  return error;
2049 }

References CLCL_ORDER, HuffmanTree::codes, uivector::data, encodeLZ77(), HuffmanTree_cleanup(), HuffmanTree_init(), HuffmanTree_makeFromFrequencies(), HuffmanTree::lengths, lodepng_free(), lodepng_malloc(), lodepng_memset(), HuffmanTree::numcodes, uivector::size, uivector_cleanup(), uivector_init(), uivector_resize(), writeBits(), writeBitsReversed(), and writeLZ77data().

2055  HuffmanTree tree_ll; /*tree for literal values and length codes*/
2056  HuffmanTree tree_d; /*tree for distance codes*/
2057 
2058  unsigned BFINAL = final;
2059  unsigned error = 0;
2060  size_t i;
2061 
2062  HuffmanTree_init(&tree_ll);
2063  HuffmanTree_init(&tree_d);
2064 
2065  error = generateFixedLitLenTree(&tree_ll);
2066  if (!error) error = generateFixedDistanceTree(&tree_d);
2067 
2068  if (!error) {
2069  writeBits(writer, BFINAL, 1);
2070  writeBits(writer, 1, 1); /*first bit of BTYPE*/
2071  writeBits(writer, 0, 1); /*second bit of BTYPE*/
2072 
2073  if (settings->use_lz77) /*LZ77 encoded*/ {
2074  uivector lz77_encoded;
2075  uivector_init(&lz77_encoded);

2077  settings->minmatch, settings->nicematch, settings->lazymatching);
2078  if (!error) writeLZ77data(writer, &lz77_encoded, &tree_ll, &tree_d);
2079  uivector_cleanup(&lz77_encoded);
2080  }
2081  else /*no LZ77, but still will be Huffman compressed*/ {
2082  for (i = datapos; i < dataend; ++i) {
2083  writeBitsReversed(writer, tree_ll.codes[data[i]], tree_ll.lengths[data[i]]);
2084  }
2085  }
2086  /*add END code*/

2088  }
2089 
2090  /*cleanup*/
2091  HuffmanTree_cleanup(&tree_ll);
2092  HuffmanTree_cleanup(&tree_d);
2093 
2094  return error;
2095 }

Definition at line 1762 of file lodepng.cpp.

1762  {
1763  /*non compressed deflate block data: 1 bit BFINAL,2 bits BTYPE,(5 bits): it jumps to start of next byte,
1764  2 bytes LEN, 2 bytes NLEN, LEN bytes literal DATA*/
1765 
1766  size_t i, numdeflateblocks = (datasize + 65534u) / 65535u;
1767  unsigned datapos = 0;
1768  for (i = 0; i != numdeflateblocks; ++i) {
1769  unsigned BFINAL, BTYPE, LEN, NLEN;
1770  unsigned char firstbyte;
1771  size_t pos = out->size;
1772 
1773  BFINAL = (i == numdeflateblocks - 1);
1774  BTYPE = 0;
1775 
1776  LEN = 65535;
1777  if (datasize - datapos < 65535u) LEN = (unsigned)datasize - datapos;
1778  NLEN = 65535 - LEN;
1779 
1780  if (!ucvector_resize(out, out->size + LEN + 5)) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
1781 
1782  firstbyte = (unsigned char)(BFINAL + ((BTYPE & 1u) << 1u) + ((BTYPE & 2u) << 1u));
1783  out->data[pos + 0] = firstbyte;
1784  out->data[pos + 1] = (unsigned char)(LEN & 255);
1785  out->data[pos + 2] = (unsigned char)(LEN >> 8u);
1786  out->data[pos + 3] = (unsigned char)(NLEN & 255);
1787  out->data[pos + 4] = (unsigned char)(NLEN >> 8u);
1788  lodepng_memcpy(out->data + pos + 5, data + datapos, LEN);
1789  datapos += LEN;
1790  }
1791 
1792  return 0;
1793 }

◆ encodeLZ77()

static unsigned encodeLZ77 ( uivector *  out,
Hash *  hash,
const unsigned char *  in,
size_t  inpos,
size_t  insize,
unsigned  windowsize,
unsigned  minmatch,
unsigned  nicematch,
unsigned  lazymatching 
)
static

Definition at line 1605 of file lodepng.cpp.

1607  {
1608  size_t pos;
1609  unsigned i, error = 0;
1610  /*for large window lengths, assume the user wants no compression loss. Otherwise, max hash chain length speedup.*/
1611  unsigned maxchainlength = windowsize >= 8192 ? windowsize : windowsize / 8u;
1612  unsigned maxlazymatch = windowsize >= 8192 ? MAX_SUPPORTED_DEFLATE_LENGTH : 64;
1613 
1614  unsigned usezeros = 1; /*not sure if setting it to false for windowsize < 8192 is better or worse*/
1615  unsigned numzeros = 0;
1616 
1617  unsigned offset; /*the offset represents the distance in LZ77 terminology*/
1618  unsigned length;
1619  unsigned lazy = 0;
1620  unsigned lazylength = 0, lazyoffset = 0;
1621  unsigned hashval;
1622  unsigned current_offset, current_length;
1623  unsigned prev_offset;
1624  const unsigned char* lastptr, * foreptr, * backptr;
1625  unsigned hashpos;
1626 
1627  if (windowsize == 0 || windowsize > 32768) return 60; /*error: windowsize smaller/larger than allowed*/
1628  if ((windowsize & (windowsize - 1)) != 0) return 90; /*error: must be power of two*/
1629 
1630  if (nicematch > MAX_SUPPORTED_DEFLATE_LENGTH) nicematch = MAX_SUPPORTED_DEFLATE_LENGTH;
1631 
1632  for (pos = inpos; pos < insize; ++pos) {
1633  size_t wpos = pos & (windowsize - 1); /*position for in 'circular' hash buffers*/
1634  unsigned chainlength = 0;
1635 
1636  hashval = getHash(in, insize, pos);
1637 
1638  if (usezeros && hashval == 0) {
1639  if (numzeros == 0) numzeros = countZeros(in, insize, pos);
1640  else if (pos + numzeros > insize || in[pos + numzeros - 1] != 0) --numzeros;
1641  }
1642  else {
1643  numzeros = 0;
1644  }
1645 
1646  updateHashChain(hash, wpos, hashval, numzeros);
1647 
1648  /*the length and offset found for the current position*/
1649  length = 0;
1650  offset = 0;
1651 
1652  hashpos = hash->chain[wpos];
1653 
1654  lastptr = &in[insize < pos + MAX_SUPPORTED_DEFLATE_LENGTH ? insize : pos + MAX_SUPPORTED_DEFLATE_LENGTH];
1655 
1656  /*search for the longest string*/
1657  prev_offset = 0;
1658  for (;;) {
1659  if (chainlength++ >= maxchainlength) break;
1660  current_offset = (unsigned)(hashpos <= wpos ? wpos - hashpos : wpos - hashpos + windowsize);
1661 
1662  if (current_offset < prev_offset) break; /*stop when went completely around the circular buffer*/
1663  prev_offset = current_offset;
1664  if (current_offset > 0) {
1665  /*test the next characters*/
1666  foreptr = &in[pos];
1667  backptr = &in[pos - current_offset];
1668 
1669  /*common case in PNGs is lots of zeros. Quickly skip over them as a speedup*/
1670  if (numzeros >= 3) {
1671  unsigned skip = hash->zeros[hashpos];
1672  if (skip > numzeros) skip = numzeros;
1673  backptr += skip;
1674  foreptr += skip;
1675  }
1676 
1677  while (foreptr != lastptr && *backptr == *foreptr) /*maximum supported length by deflate is max length*/ {
1678  ++backptr;
1679  ++foreptr;
1680  }
1681  current_length = (unsigned)(foreptr - &in[pos]);
1682 
1683  if (current_length > length) {
1684  length = current_length; /*the longest length*/
1685  offset = current_offset; /*the offset that is related to this longest length*/
1686  /*jump out once a length of max length is found (speed gain). This also jumps
1687  out if length is MAX_SUPPORTED_DEFLATE_LENGTH*/
1688  if (current_length >= nicematch) break;
1689  }
1690  }
1691 
1692  if (hashpos == hash->chain[hashpos]) break;
1693 
1694  if (numzeros >= 3 && length > numzeros) {
1695  hashpos = hash->chainz[hashpos];
1696  if (hash->zeros[hashpos] != numzeros) break;
1697  }
1698  else {
1699  hashpos = hash->chain[hashpos];
1700  /*outdated hash value, happens if particular value was not encountered in whole last window*/
1701  if (hash->val[hashpos] != (int)hashval) break;
1702  }
1703  }
1704 
1705  if (lazymatching) {
1706  if (!lazy && length >= 3 && length <= maxlazymatch && length < MAX_SUPPORTED_DEFLATE_LENGTH) {
1707  lazy = 1;
1708  lazylength = length;
1709  lazyoffset = offset;
1710  continue; /*try the next byte*/
1711  }
1712  if (lazy) {
1713  lazy = 0;
1714  if (pos == 0) ERROR_BREAK(81);
1715  if (length > lazylength + 1) {
1716  /*push the previous character as literal*/
1717  if (!uivector_push_back(out, in[pos - 1])) ERROR_BREAK(83 /*alloc fail*/);
1718  }
1719  else {
1720  length = lazylength;
1721  offset = lazyoffset;
1722  hash->head[hashval] = -1; /*the same hashchain update will be done, this ensures no wrong alteration*/
1723  hash->headz[numzeros] = -1; /*idem*/
1724  --pos;
1725  }
1726  }
1727  }
1728  if (length >= 3 && offset > windowsize) ERROR_BREAK(86 /*too big (or overflown negative) offset*/);
1729 
1730  /*encode it as length/distance pair or literal value*/
1731  if (length < 3) /*only lengths of 3 or higher are supported as length/distance pair*/ {
1732  if (!uivector_push_back(out, in[pos])) ERROR_BREAK(83 /*alloc fail*/);
1733  }
1734  else if (length < minmatch || (length == 3 && offset > 4096)) {
1735  /*compensate for the fact that longer offsets have more extra bits, a
1736  length of only 3 may be not worth it then*/
1737  if (!uivector_push_back(out, in[pos])) ERROR_BREAK(83 /*alloc fail*/);
1738  }
1739  else {
1740  addLengthDistance(out, length, offset);
1741  for (i = 1; i < length; ++i) {
1742  ++pos;
1743  wpos = pos & (windowsize - 1);
1744  hashval = getHash(in, insize, pos);
1745  if (usezeros && hashval == 0) {
1746  if (numzeros == 0) numzeros = countZeros(in, insize, pos);
1747  else if (pos + numzeros > insize || in[pos + numzeros - 1] != 0) --numzeros;
1748  }
1749  else {
1750  numzeros = 0;
1751  }
1752  updateHashChain(hash, wpos, hashval, numzeros);
1753  }
1754  }
1755  } /*end of the loop through each character of input*/
1756 
1757  return error;
1758 }

References addLengthDistance(), Hash::chain, Hash::chainz, countZeros(), getHash(), Hash::head, Hash::headz, MAX_SUPPORTED_DEFLATE_LENGTH, uivector_push_back(), updateHashChain(), Hash::val, and Hash::zeros.

511  {
512  size_t start = reader->bp >> 3u;
513  size_t size = reader->size;
514  if (start + 2u < size) {
515  reader->buffer = (unsigned)reader->data[start + 0] | ((unsigned)reader->data[start + 1] << 8u) |
516  ((unsigned)reader->data[start + 2] << 16u);
517  reader->buffer >>= (reader->bp & 7u);
518  return 1;
519  }
520  else {

523  if (start + 1u < size) reader->buffer |= ((unsigned)reader->data[start + 1] << 8u);

◆ filter()

static unsigned filter ( unsigned char *  out,
const unsigned char *  in,
unsigned  w,
unsigned  h,
const LodePNGColorMode *  color,
const LodePNGEncoderSettings *  settings 
)
static

Definition at line 5543 of file lodepng.cpp.

5544  {
5545  /*
5546  For PNG filter method 0
5547  out must be a buffer with as size: h + (w * h * bpp + 7u) / 8u, because there are
5548  the scanlines with 1 extra byte per scanline
5549  */
5550 
5551  unsigned bpp = lodepng_get_bpp(color);
5552  /*the width of a scanline in bytes, not including the filter type*/
5553  size_t linebytes = lodepng_get_raw_size_idat(w, 1, bpp) - 1u;
5554 
5555  /*bytewidth is used for filtering, is 1 when bpp < 8, number of bytes per pixel otherwise*/
5556  size_t bytewidth = (bpp + 7u) / 8u;
5557  const unsigned char* prevline = 0;
5558  unsigned x, y;
5559  unsigned error = 0;
5560  LodePNGFilterStrategy strategy = settings->filter_strategy;
5561 
5562  /*
5563  There is a heuristic called the minimum sum of absolute differences heuristic, suggested by the PNG standard:
5564  * If the image type is Palette, or the bit depth is smaller than 8, then do not filter the image (i.e.
5565  use fixed filtering, with the filter None).
5566  * (The other case) If the image type is Grayscale or RGB (with or without Alpha), and the bit depth is
5567  not smaller than 8, then use adaptive filtering heuristic as follows: independently for each row, apply
5568  all five filters and select the filter that produces the smallest sum of absolute values per row.
5569  This heuristic is used if filter strategy is LFS_MINSUM and filter_palette_zero is true.
5570 
5571  If filter_palette_zero is true and filter_strategy is not LFS_MINSUM, the above heuristic is followed,
5572  but for "the other case", whatever strategy filter_strategy is set to instead of the minimum sum
5573  heuristic is used.
5574  */
5575  if (settings->filter_palette_zero &&
5576  (color->colortype == LCT_PALETTE || color->bitdepth < 8)) strategy = LFS_ZERO;
5577 
5578  if (bpp == 0) return 31; /*error: invalid color type*/
5579 
5580  if (strategy >= LFS_ZERO && strategy <= LFS_FOUR) {
5581  unsigned char type = (unsigned char)strategy;
5582  for (y = 0; y != h; ++y) {
5583  size_t outindex = (1 + linebytes) * y; /*the extra filterbyte added to each row*/
5584  size_t inindex = linebytes * y;
5585  out[outindex] = type; /*filter type byte*/
5586  filterScanline(&out[outindex + 1], &in[inindex], prevline, linebytes, bytewidth, type);
5587  prevline = &in[inindex];
5588  }
5589  }
5590  else if (strategy == LFS_MINSUM) {
5591  /*adaptive filtering*/
5592  unsigned char* attempt[5]; /*five filtering attempts, one for each filter type*/
5593  size_t smallest = 0;
5594  unsigned char type, bestType = 0;
5595 
5596  for (type = 0; type != 5; ++type) {
5597  attempt[type] = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(linebytes);
5598  if (!attempt[type]) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5599  }
5600 
5601  if (!error) {
5602  for (y = 0; y != h; ++y) {
5603  /*try the 5 filter types*/
5604  for (type = 0; type != 5; ++type) {
5605  size_t sum = 0;
5606  filterScanline(attempt[type], &in[y * linebytes], prevline, linebytes, bytewidth, type);
5607 
5608  /*calculate the sum of the result*/
5609  if (type == 0) {
5610  for (x = 0; x != linebytes; ++x) sum += (unsigned char)(attempt[type][x]);
5611  }
5612  else {
5613  for (x = 0; x != linebytes; ++x) {
5614  /*For differences, each byte should be treated as signed, values above 127 are negative
5615  (converted to signed char). Filtertype 0 isn't a difference though, so use unsigned there.
5616  This means filtertype 0 is almost never chosen, but that is justified.*/
5617  unsigned char s = attempt[type][x];
5618  sum += s < 128 ? s : (255U - s);
5619  }
5620  }
5621 
5622  /*check if this is smallest sum (or if type == 0 it's the first case so always store the values)*/
5623  if (type == 0 || sum < smallest) {
5624  bestType = type;
5625  smallest = sum;
5626  }
5627  }
5628 
5629  prevline = &in[y * linebytes];
5630 
5631  /*now fill the out values*/
5632  out[y * (linebytes + 1)] = bestType; /*the first byte of a scanline will be the filter type*/
5633  for (x = 0; x != linebytes; ++x) out[y * (linebytes + 1) + 1 + x] = attempt[bestType][x];
5634  }
5635  }
5636 
5637  for (type = 0; type != 5; ++type) lodepng_free(attempt[type]);
5638  }
5639  else if (strategy == LFS_ENTROPY) {
5640  unsigned char* attempt[5]; /*five filtering attempts, one for each filter type*/
5641  size_t bestSum = 0;
5642  unsigned type, bestType = 0;
5643  unsigned count[256];
5644 
5645  for (type = 0; type != 5; ++type) {
5646  attempt[type] = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(linebytes);
5647  if (!attempt[type]) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5648  }
5649 
5650  if (!error) {
5651  for (y = 0; y != h; ++y) {
5652  /*try the 5 filter types*/
5653  for (type = 0; type != 5; ++type) {
5654  size_t sum = 0;
5655  filterScanline(attempt[type], &in[y * linebytes], prevline, linebytes, bytewidth, type);
5656  lodepng_memset(count, 0, 256 * sizeof(*count));
5657  for (x = 0; x != linebytes; ++x) ++count[attempt[type][x]];
5658  ++count[type]; /*the filter type itself is part of the scanline*/
5659  for (x = 0; x != 256; ++x) {
5660  sum += ilog2i(count[x]);
5661  }
5662  /*check if this is smallest sum (or if type == 0 it's the first case so always store the values)*/
5663  if (type == 0 || sum > bestSum) {
5664  bestType = type;
5665  bestSum = sum;
5666  }
5667  }
5668 
5669  prevline = &in[y * linebytes];
5670 
5671  /*now fill the out values*/
5672  out[y * (linebytes + 1)] = bestType; /*the first byte of a scanline will be the filter type*/
5673  for (x = 0; x != linebytes; ++x) out[y * (linebytes + 1) + 1 + x] = attempt[bestType][x];
5674  }
5675  }
5676 
5677  for (type = 0; type != 5; ++type) lodepng_free(attempt[type]);
5678  }
5679  else if (strategy == LFS_PREDEFINED) {
5680  for (y = 0; y != h; ++y) {
5681  size_t outindex = (1 + linebytes) * y; /*the extra filterbyte added to each row*/
5682  size_t inindex = linebytes * y;
5683  unsigned char type = settings->predefined_filters[y];
5684  out[outindex] = type; /*filter type byte*/
5685  filterScanline(&out[outindex + 1], &in[inindex], prevline, linebytes, bytewidth, type);
5686  prevline = &in[inindex];
5687  }
5688  }
5689  else if (strategy == LFS_BRUTE_FORCE) {
5690  /*brute force filter chooser.
5691  deflate the scanline after every filter attempt to see which one deflates best.
5692  This is very slow and gives only slightly smaller, sometimes even larger, result*/
5693  size_t size[5];
5694  unsigned char* attempt[5]; /*five filtering attempts, one for each filter type*/
5695  size_t smallest = 0;
5696  unsigned type = 0, bestType = 0;
5697  unsigned char* dummy;
5698  LodePNGCompressSettings zlibsettings;
5699  lodepng_memcpy(&zlibsettings, &settings->zlibsettings, sizeof(LodePNGCompressSettings));
5700  /*use fixed tree on the attempts so that the tree is not adapted to the filtertype on purpose,
5701  to simulate the true case where the tree is the same for the whole image. Sometimes it gives
5702  better result with dynamic tree anyway. Using the fixed tree sometimes gives worse, but in rare
5703  cases better compression. It does make this a bit less slow, so it's worth doing this.*/
5704  zlibsettings.btype = 1;
5705  /*a custom encoder likely doesn't read the btype setting and is optimized for complete PNG
5706  images only, so disable it*/
5707  zlibsettings.custom_zlib = 0;
5708  zlibsettings.custom_deflate = 0;
5709  for (type = 0; type != 5; ++type) {
5710  attempt[type] = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(linebytes);
5711  if (!attempt[type]) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5712  }
5713  if (!error) {
5714  for (y = 0; y != h; ++y) /*try the 5 filter types*/ {
5715  for (type = 0; type != 5; ++type) {
5716  unsigned testsize = (unsigned)linebytes;
5717  /*if(testsize > 8) testsize /= 8;*/ /*it already works good enough by testing a part of the row*/
5718 
5719  filterScanline(attempt[type], &in[y * linebytes], prevline, linebytes, bytewidth, type);
5720  size[type] = 0;
5721  dummy = 0;
5722  zlib_compress(&dummy, &size[type], attempt[type], testsize, &zlibsettings);
5723  lodepng_free(dummy);
5724  /*check if this is smallest size (or if type == 0 it's the first case so always store the values)*/
5725  if (type == 0 || size[type] < smallest) {
5726  bestType = type;
5727  smallest = size[type];
5728  }
5729  }
5730  prevline = &in[y * linebytes];
5731  out[y * (linebytes + 1)] = bestType; /*the first byte of a scanline will be the filter type*/
5732  for (x = 0; x != linebytes; ++x) out[y * (linebytes + 1) + 1 + x] = attempt[bestType][x];
5733  }
5734  }
5735  for (type = 0; type != 5; ++type) lodepng_free(attempt[type]);
5736  }
5737  else return 88; /* unknown filter strategy */
5738 
5739  return error;
5740 }

References filterScanline(), ilog2i(), lodepng_free(), lodepng_get_bpp(), lodepng_get_raw_size_idat(), lodepng_malloc(), lodepng_memcpy(), lodepng_memset(), and zlib_compress().

◆ filterScanline()

static void filterScanline ( unsigned char *  out,
const unsigned char *  scanline,
const unsigned char *  prevline,
size_t  length,
size_t  bytewidth,
unsigned char  filterType 
)
static

Definition at line 5475 of file lodepng.cpp.

5476  {
5477  size_t i;
5478  switch (filterType) {
5479  case 0: /*None*/
5480  for (i = 0; i != length; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i];
5481  break;
5482  case 1: /*Sub*/
5483  for (i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i];
5484  for (i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i] - scanline[i - bytewidth];
5485  break;
5486  case 2: /*Up*/
5487  if (prevline) {
5488  for (i = 0; i != length; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i] - prevline[i];
5489  }
5490  else {
5491  for (i = 0; i != length; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i];
5492  }
5493  break;
5494  case 3: /*Average*/
5495  if (prevline) {
5496  for (i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i] - (prevline[i] >> 1);
5497  for (i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i] - ((scanline[i - bytewidth] + prevline[i]) >> 1);
5498  }
5499  else {
5500  for (i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i];
5501  for (i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i] - (scanline[i - bytewidth] >> 1);
5502  }
5503  break;
5504  case 4: /*Paeth*/
5505  if (prevline) {
5506  /*paethPredictor(0, prevline[i], 0) is always prevline[i]*/
5507  for (i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) out[i] = (scanline[i] - prevline[i]);
5508  for (i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) {
5509  out[i] = (scanline[i] - paethPredictor(scanline[i - bytewidth], prevline[i], prevline[i - bytewidth]));
5510  }
5511  }
5512  else {
5513  for (i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) out[i] = scanline[i];
5514  /*paethPredictor(scanline[i - bytewidth], 0, 0) is always scanline[i - bytewidth]*/
5515  for (i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) out[i] = (scanline[i] - scanline[i - bytewidth]);
5516  }
5517  break;
5518  default: return; /*invalid filter type given*/
5519  }
5520 }

◆ getHash()

static unsigned getHash ( const unsigned char *  data,
size_t  size,
size_t  pos 
)
static

Definition at line 1555 of file lodepng.cpp.

1555  {
1556  unsigned result = 0;
1557  if (pos + 2 < size) {
1558  /*A simple shift and xor hash is used. Since the data of PNGs is dominated
1559  by zeroes due to the filters, a better hash does not have a significant
1560  effect on speed in traversing the chain, and causes more time spend on
1561  calculating the hash.*/
1562  result ^= ((unsigned)data[pos + 0] << 0u);
1563  result ^= ((unsigned)data[pos + 1] << 4u);
1564  result ^= ((unsigned)data[pos + 2] << 8u);
1565  }
1566  else {
1567  size_t amount, i;
1568  if (pos >= size) return 0;
1569  amount = size - pos;
1570  for (i = 0; i != amount; ++i) result ^= ((unsigned)data[pos + i] << (i * 8u));
1571  }
1572  return result & HASH_BIT_MASK;
1573 }

References HASH_BIT_MASK.

3417  && 256U * in[i * 6 + 0] + in[i * 6 + 1] == mode->key_r
3418  && 256U * in[i * 6 + 2] + in[i * 6 + 3] == mode->key_g
3419  && 256U * in[i * 6 + 4] + in[i * 6 + 5] == mode->key_b ? 0 : 255;
3420  }
3421  }
3422  }
3423  else if (mode->colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
3424  if (mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3425  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3426  unsigned index = in[i];
3427  /*out of bounds of palette not checked: see lodepng_color_mode_alloc_palette.*/
3428  lodepng_memcpy(buffer, &mode->palette[index * 4], 4);
3429  }
3430  }
3431  else {
3432  size_t j = 0;
3433  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3434  unsigned index = readBitsFromReversedStream(&j, in, mode->bitdepth);
3435  /*out of bounds of palette not checked: see lodepng_color_mode_alloc_palette.*/
3436  lodepng_memcpy(buffer, &mode->palette[index * 4], 4);
3437  }
3438  }
3439  }
3440  else if (mode->colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA) {
3441  if (mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3442  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3443  buffer[0] = buffer[1] = buffer[2] = in[i * 2 + 0];
3444  buffer[3] = in[i * 2 + 1];
3445  }
3446  }
3447  else {
3448  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3449  buffer[0] = buffer[1] = buffer[2] = in[i * 4 + 0];
3450  buffer[3] = in[i * 4 + 2];
3451  }
3452  }
3453  }
3454  else if (mode->colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
3455  if (mode->bitdepth == 8) {
3456  lodepng_memcpy(buffer, in, numpixels * 4);
3457  }
3458  else {
3459  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i, buffer += num_channels) {
3460  buffer[0] = in[i * 8 + 0];
3461  buffer[1] = in[i * 8 + 2];
3462  buffer[2] = in[i * 8 + 4];
3463  buffer[3] = in[i * 8 + 6];
3464  }
3465  }
3466  }
3467 }

Definition at line 1140 of file lodepng.cpp.

1141  {
1142  /*make sure that length values that aren't filled in will be 0, or a wrong tree will be generated*/
1143  unsigned error = 0;
1144  unsigned n, HLIT, HDIST, HCLEN, i;
1145 
1146  /*see comments in deflateDynamic for explanation of the context and these variables, it is analogous*/
1147  unsigned* bitlen_ll = 0; /*lit,len code lengths*/
1148  unsigned* bitlen_d = 0; /*dist code lengths*/
1149  /*code length code lengths ("clcl"), the bit lengths of the huffman tree used to compress bitlen_ll and bitlen_d*/
1150  unsigned* bitlen_cl = 0;
1151  HuffmanTree tree_cl; /*the code tree for code length codes (the huffman tree for compressed huffman trees)*/
1152 
1153  if (!ensureBits17(reader, 14)) return 49; /*error: the bit pointer is or will go past the memory*/
1154 
1155  /*number of literal/length codes + 257. Unlike the spec, the value 257 is added to it here already*/
1156  HLIT = readBits(reader, 5) + 257;
1157  /*number of distance codes. Unlike the spec, the value 1 is added to it here already*/
1158  HDIST = readBits(reader, 5) + 1;
1159  /*number of code length codes. Unlike the spec, the value 4 is added to it here already*/
1160  HCLEN = readBits(reader, 4) + 4;
1161 
1162  bitlen_cl = (unsigned*)lodepng_malloc(NUM_CODE_LENGTH_CODES * sizeof(unsigned));
1163  if (!bitlen_cl) return 83 /*alloc fail*/;
1164 
1165  HuffmanTree_init(&tree_cl);
1166 
1167  while (!error) {
1168  /*read the code length codes out of 3 * (amount of code length codes) bits*/
1169  if (lodepng_gtofl(reader->bp, HCLEN * 3, reader->bitsize)) {
1170  ERROR_BREAK(50); /*error: the bit pointer is or will go past the memory*/
1171  }
1172  for (i = 0; i != HCLEN; ++i) {
1173  ensureBits9(reader, 3); /*out of bounds already checked above */
1174  bitlen_cl[CLCL_ORDER[i]] = readBits(reader, 3);
1175  }
1176  for (i = HCLEN; i != NUM_CODE_LENGTH_CODES; ++i) {
1177  bitlen_cl[CLCL_ORDER[i]] = 0;
1178  }
1179 
1180  error = HuffmanTree_makeFromLengths(&tree_cl, bitlen_cl, NUM_CODE_LENGTH_CODES, 7);
1181  if (error) break;
1182 
1183  /*now we can use this tree to read the lengths for the tree that this function will return*/
1184  bitlen_ll = (unsigned*)lodepng_malloc(NUM_DEFLATE_CODE_SYMBOLS * sizeof(unsigned));
1185  bitlen_d = (unsigned*)lodepng_malloc(NUM_DISTANCE_SYMBOLS * sizeof(unsigned));
1186  if (!bitlen_ll || !bitlen_d) ERROR_BREAK(83 /*alloc fail*/);
1187  lodepng_memset(bitlen_ll, 0, NUM_DEFLATE_CODE_SYMBOLS * sizeof(*bitlen_ll));
1188  lodepng_memset(bitlen_d, 0, NUM_DISTANCE_SYMBOLS * sizeof(*bitlen_d));
1189 
1190  /*i is the current symbol we're reading in the part that contains the code lengths of lit/len and dist codes*/
1191  i = 0;
1192  while (i < HLIT + HDIST) {
1193  unsigned code;
1194  ensureBits25(reader, 22); /* up to 15 bits for huffman code, up to 7 extra bits below*/
1195  code = huffmanDecodeSymbol(reader, &tree_cl);
1196  if (code <= 15) /*a length code*/ {
1197  if (i < HLIT) bitlen_ll[i] = code;
1198  else bitlen_d[i - HLIT] = code;
1199  ++i;
1200  }
1201  else if (code == 16) /*repeat previous*/ {
1202  unsigned replength = 3; /*read in the 2 bits that indicate repeat length (3-6)*/
1203  unsigned value; /*set value to the previous code*/
1204 
1205  if (i == 0) ERROR_BREAK(54); /*can't repeat previous if i is 0*/
1206 
1207  replength += readBits(reader, 2);
1208 
1209  if (i < HLIT + 1) value = bitlen_ll[i - 1];
1210  else value = bitlen_d[i - HLIT - 1];
1211  /*repeat this value in the next lengths*/
1212  for (n = 0; n < replength; ++n) {
1213  if (i >= HLIT + HDIST) ERROR_BREAK(13); /*error: i is larger than the amount of codes*/
1214  if (i < HLIT) bitlen_ll[i] = value;
1215  else bitlen_d[i - HLIT] = value;
1216  ++i;
1217  }
1218  }
1219  else if (code == 17) /*repeat "0" 3-10 times*/ {
1220  unsigned replength = 3; /*read in the bits that indicate repeat length*/
1221  replength += readBits(reader, 3);
1222 
1223  /*repeat this value in the next lengths*/
1224  for (n = 0; n < replength; ++n) {
1225  if (i >= HLIT + HDIST) ERROR_BREAK(14); /*error: i is larger than the amount of codes*/
1226 
1227  if (i < HLIT) bitlen_ll[i] = 0;
1228  else bitlen_d[i - HLIT] = 0;
1229  ++i;
1230  }
1231  }
1232  else if (code == 18) /*repeat "0" 11-138 times*/ {
1233  unsigned replength = 11; /*read in the bits that indicate repeat length*/
1234  replength += readBits(reader, 7);
1235 
1236  /*repeat this value in the next lengths*/
1237  for (n = 0; n < replength; ++n) {
1238  if (i >= HLIT + HDIST) ERROR_BREAK(15); /*error: i is larger than the amount of codes*/
1239 
1240  if (i < HLIT) bitlen_ll[i] = 0;
1241  else bitlen_d[i - HLIT] = 0;
1242  ++i;
1243  }
1244  }
1245  else /*if(code == INVALIDSYMBOL)*/ {
1246  ERROR_BREAK(16); /*error: tried to read disallowed huffman symbol*/
1247  }
1248  /*check if any of the ensureBits above went out of bounds*/
1249  if (reader->bp > reader->bitsize) {
1250  /*return error code 10 or 11 depending on the situation that happened in huffmanDecodeSymbol
1251  (10=no endcode, 11=wrong jump outside of tree)*/
1252  /* TODO: revise error codes 10,11,50: the above comment is no longer valid */
1253  ERROR_BREAK(50); /*error, bit pointer jumps past memory*/
1254  }
1255  }
1256  if (error) break;
1257 
1258  if (bitlen_ll[256] == 0) ERROR_BREAK(64); /*the length of the end code 256 must be larger than 0*/
1259 
1260  /*now we've finally got HLIT and HDIST, so generate the code trees, and the function is done*/
1261  error = HuffmanTree_makeFromLengths(tree_ll, bitlen_ll, NUM_DEFLATE_CODE_SYMBOLS, 15);
1262  if (error) break;
1263  error = HuffmanTree_makeFromLengths(tree_d, bitlen_d, NUM_DISTANCE_SYMBOLS, 15);
1264 
1265  break; /*end of error-while*/
1266  }
1267 
1268  lodepng_free(bitlen_cl);
1269  lodepng_free(bitlen_ll);
1270  lodepng_free(bitlen_d);
1271  HuffmanTree_cleanup(&tree_cl);
1272 
1273  return error;
1274 }

1108  unsigned short code = peekBits(reader, FIRSTBITS);
1109  unsigned short l = codetree->table_len[code];
1110  unsigned short value = codetree->table_value[code];
1111  if (l <= FIRSTBITS) {
1112  advanceBits(reader, l);
1113  return value;
1114  }
1115  else {
1116  unsigned index2;
1117  advanceBits(reader, FIRSTBITS);
1118  index2 = value + peekBits(reader, l - FIRSTBITS);

◆ HuffmanTree_makeFromLengths2()

static unsigned HuffmanTree_makeFromLengths2 ( HuffmanTree *  tree)
static

Definition at line 816 of file lodepng.cpp.

816  {
817  unsigned* blcount;
818  unsigned* nextcode;
819  unsigned error = 0;
820  unsigned bits, n;
821 
822  tree->codes = (unsigned*)lodepng_malloc(tree->numcodes * sizeof(unsigned));
823  blcount = (unsigned*)lodepng_malloc((tree->maxbitlen + 1) * sizeof(unsigned));
824  nextcode = (unsigned*)lodepng_malloc((tree->maxbitlen + 1) * sizeof(unsigned));
825  if (!tree->codes || !blcount || !nextcode) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
826 
827  if (!error) {
828  for (n = 0; n != tree->maxbitlen + 1; n++) blcount[n] = nextcode[n] = 0;
829  /*step 1: count number of instances of each code length*/
830  for (bits = 0; bits != tree->numcodes; ++bits) ++blcount[tree->lengths[bits]];
831  /*step 2: generate the nextcode values*/
832  for (bits = 1; bits <= tree->maxbitlen; ++bits) {
833  nextcode[bits] = (nextcode[bits - 1] + blcount[bits - 1]) << 1u;
834  }
835  /*step 3: generate all the codes*/
836  for (n = 0; n != tree->numcodes; ++n) {
837  if (tree->lengths[n] != 0) {
838  tree->codes[n] = nextcode[tree->lengths[n]]++;
839  /*remove superfluous bits from the code*/
840  tree->codes[n] &= ((1u << tree->lengths[n]) - 1u);
841  }
842  }
843  }
844 
845  lodepng_free(blcount);
846  lodepng_free(nextcode);
847 
848  if (!error) error = HuffmanTree_makeTable(tree);
849  return error;
850 }

References HuffmanTree::codes, HuffmanTree_makeTable(), HuffmanTree::lengths, lodepng_free(), lodepng_malloc(), HuffmanTree::maxbitlen, and HuffmanTree::numcodes.

Referenced by HuffmanTree_makeFromFrequencies(), and HuffmanTree_makeFromLengths().

Here is the call graph for this function:
Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ HuffmanTree_makeTable()

static unsigned HuffmanTree_makeTable ( HuffmanTree *  tree)
static

Definition at line 694 of file lodepng.cpp.

694  {
695  static const unsigned headsize = 1u << FIRSTBITS; /*size of the first table*/
696  static const unsigned mask = (1u << FIRSTBITS) /*headsize*/ - 1u;
697  size_t i, numpresent, pointer, size; /*total table size*/
698  unsigned* maxlens = (unsigned*)lodepng_malloc(headsize * sizeof(unsigned));
699  if (!maxlens) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
700 
701  /* compute maxlens: max total bit length of symbols sharing prefix in the first table*/
702  lodepng_memset(maxlens, 0, headsize * sizeof(*maxlens));
703  for (i = 0; i < tree->numcodes; i++) {
704  unsigned symbol = tree->codes[i];
705  unsigned l = tree->lengths[i];
706  unsigned index;
707  if (l <= FIRSTBITS) continue; /*symbols that fit in first table don't increase secondary table size*/
708  /*get the FIRSTBITS MSBs, the MSBs of the symbol are encoded first. See later comment about the reversing*/
709  index = reverseBits(symbol >> (l - FIRSTBITS), FIRSTBITS);
710  maxlens[index] = LODEPNG_MAX(maxlens[index], l);
711  }
712  /* compute total table size: size of first table plus all secondary tables for symbols longer than FIRSTBITS */
713  size = headsize;
714  for (i = 0; i < headsize; ++i) {
715  unsigned l = maxlens[i];
716  if (l > FIRSTBITS) size += (1u << (l - FIRSTBITS));
717  }
718  tree->table_len = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(size * sizeof(*tree->table_len));
719  tree->table_value = (unsigned short*)lodepng_malloc(size * sizeof(*tree->table_value));
720  if (!tree->table_len || !tree->table_value) {
721  lodepng_free(maxlens);
722  /* freeing tree->table values is done at a higher scope */
723  return 83; /*alloc fail*/
724  }
725  /*initialize with an invalid length to indicate unused entries*/
726  for (i = 0; i < size; ++i) tree->table_len[i] = 16;
727 
728  /*fill in the first table for long symbols: max prefix size and pointer to secondary tables*/
729  pointer = headsize;
730  for (i = 0; i < headsize; ++i) {
731  unsigned l = maxlens[i];
732  if (l <= FIRSTBITS) continue;
733  tree->table_len[i] = l;
734  tree->table_value[i] = pointer;
735  pointer += (1u << (l - FIRSTBITS));
736  }
737  lodepng_free(maxlens);
738 
739  /*fill in the first table for short symbols, or secondary table for long symbols*/
740  numpresent = 0;
741  for (i = 0; i < tree->numcodes; ++i) {
742  unsigned l = tree->lengths[i];
743  unsigned symbol = tree->codes[i]; /*the huffman bit pattern. i itself is the value.*/
744  /*reverse bits, because the huffman bits are given in MSB first order but the bit reader reads LSB first*/
745  unsigned reverse = reverseBits(symbol, l);
746  if (l == 0) continue;
747  numpresent++;
748 
749  if (l <= FIRSTBITS) {
750  /*short symbol, fully in first table, replicated num times if l < FIRSTBITS*/
751  unsigned num = 1u << (FIRSTBITS - l);
752  unsigned j;
753  for (j = 0; j < num; ++j) {
754  /*bit reader will read the l bits of symbol first, the remaining FIRSTBITS - l bits go to the MSB's*/
755  unsigned index = reverse | (j << l);
756  if (tree->table_len[index] != 16) return 55; /*invalid tree: long symbol shares prefix with short symbol*/
757  tree->table_len[index] = l;
758  tree->table_value[index] = i;
759  }
760  }
761  else {
762  /*long symbol, shares prefix with other long symbols in first lookup table, needs second lookup*/
763  /*the FIRSTBITS MSBs of the symbol are the first table index*/
764  unsigned index = reverse & mask;
765  unsigned maxlen = tree->table_len[index];
766  /*log2 of secondary table length, should be >= l - FIRSTBITS*/
767  unsigned tablelen = maxlen - FIRSTBITS;
768  unsigned start = tree->table_value[index]; /*starting index in secondary table*/
769  unsigned num = 1u << (tablelen - (l - FIRSTBITS)); /*amount of entries of this symbol in secondary table*/
770  unsigned j;
771  if (maxlen < l) return 55; /*invalid tree: long symbol shares prefix with short symbol*/
772  for (j = 0; j < num; ++j) {
773  unsigned reverse2 = reverse >> FIRSTBITS; /* l - FIRSTBITS bits */
774  unsigned index2 = start + (reverse2 | (j << (l - FIRSTBITS)));
775  tree->table_len[index2] = l;
776  tree->table_value[index2] = i;
777  }
778  }
779  }
780 
781  if (numpresent < 2) {
782  /* In case of exactly 1 symbol, in theory the huffman symbol needs 0 bits,
783  but deflate uses 1 bit instead. In case of 0 symbols, no symbols can
784  appear at all, but such huffman tree could still exist (e.g. if distance
785  codes are never used). In both cases, not all symbols of the table will be
786  filled in. Fill them in with an invalid symbol value so returning them from
787  huffmanDecodeSymbol will cause error. */
788  for (i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
789  if (tree->table_len[i] == 16) {
790  /* As length, use a value smaller than FIRSTBITS for the head table,
791  and a value larger than FIRSTBITS for the secondary table, to ensure
792  valid behavior for advanceBits when reading this symbol. */
793  tree->table_len[i] = (i < headsize) ? 1 : (FIRSTBITS + 1);
794  tree->table_value[i] = INVALIDSYMBOL;
795  }
796  }
797  }
798  else {
799  /* A good huffman tree has N * 2 - 1 nodes, of which N - 1 are internal nodes.
800  If that is not the case (due to too long length codes), the table will not
801  have been fully used, and this is an error (not all bit combinations can be
802  decoded): an oversubscribed huffman tree, indicated by error 55. */
803  for (i = 0; i < size; ++i) {
804  if (tree->table_len[i] == 16) return 55;
805  }
806  }
807 
808  return 0;
809 }

References HuffmanTree::codes, HuffmanTree::lengths, lodepng_free(), lodepng_malloc(), lodepng_memset(), HuffmanTree::numcodes, reverseBits(), HuffmanTree::table_len, and HuffmanTree::table_value.

Referenced by HuffmanTree_makeFromLengths2().

5523  {
5524  size_t result = 0;
5525  if (i >= 65536) { result += 16; i >>= 16; }
5526  if (i >= 256) { result += 8; i >>= 8; }
5527  if (i >= 16) { result += 4; i >>= 4; }
5528  if (i >= 4) { result += 2; i >>= 2; }
5529  if (i >= 2) { result += 1; /*i >>= 1;*/ }
5530  return result;
5531 }

◆ ilog2i()

static size_t ilog2i ( size_t  i)
static

Definition at line 5534 of file lodepng.cpp.

5534  {
5535  size_t l;
5536  if (i == 0) return 0;
5537  l = ilog2(i);
5538  /* approximate i*log2(i): l is integer logarithm, ((i - (1u << l)) << 1u)
5539  linearly approximates the missing fractional part multiplied by i */
5540  return i * l + ((i - (1u << l)) << 1u);
5541 }

Here is the call graph for this function:
Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ inflateHuffmanBlock()

static unsigned inflateHuffmanBlock ( ucvector *  out,
LodePNGBitReader *  reader,
unsigned  btype 
)
static

Definition at line 1277 of file lodepng.cpp.

1278  {
1279  unsigned error = 0;
1280  HuffmanTree tree_ll; /*the huffman tree for literal and length codes*/
1281  HuffmanTree tree_d; /*the huffman tree for distance codes*/
1282 
1283  HuffmanTree_init(&tree_ll);
1284  HuffmanTree_init(&tree_d);
1285 
1286  if (btype == 1) error = getTreeInflateFixed(&tree_ll, &tree_d);
1287  else /*if(btype == 2)*/ error = getTreeInflateDynamic(&tree_ll, &tree_d, reader);
1288 
1289  while (!error) /*decode all symbols until end reached, breaks at end code*/ {
1290  /*code_ll is literal, length or end code*/
1291  unsigned code_ll;
1292  ensureBits25(reader, 20); /* up to 15 for the huffman symbol, up to 5 for the length extra bits */
1293  code_ll = huffmanDecodeSymbol(reader, &tree_ll);
1294  if (code_ll <= 255) /*literal symbol*/ {
1295  if (!ucvector_resize(out, out->size + 1)) ERROR_BREAK(83 /*alloc fail*/);
1296  out->data[out->size - 1] = (unsigned char)code_ll;
1297  }
1298  else if (code_ll >= FIRST_LENGTH_CODE_INDEX && code_ll <= LAST_LENGTH_CODE_INDEX) /*length code*/ {
1299  unsigned code_d, distance;
1300  unsigned numextrabits_l, numextrabits_d; /*extra bits for length and distance*/
1301  size_t start, backward, length;
1302 
1303  /*part 1: get length base*/
1304  length = LENGTHBASE[code_ll - FIRST_LENGTH_CODE_INDEX];
1305 
1306  /*part 2: get extra bits and add the value of that to length*/
1307  numextrabits_l = LENGTHEXTRA[code_ll - FIRST_LENGTH_CODE_INDEX];
1308  if (numextrabits_l != 0) {
1309  /* bits already ensured above */
1310  length += readBits(reader, numextrabits_l);
1311  }
1312 
1313  /*part 3: get distance code*/
1314  ensureBits32(reader, 28); /* up to 15 for the huffman symbol, up to 13 for the extra bits */
1315  code_d = huffmanDecodeSymbol(reader, &tree_d);
1316  if (code_d > 29) {
1317  if (code_d <= 31) {
1318  ERROR_BREAK(18); /*error: invalid distance code (30-31 are never used)*/
1319  }
1320  else /* if(code_d == INVALIDSYMBOL) */ {
1321  ERROR_BREAK(16); /*error: tried to read disallowed huffman symbol*/
1322  }
1323  }
1324  distance = DISTANCEBASE[code_d];
1325 
1326  /*part 4: get extra bits from distance*/
1327  numextrabits_d = DISTANCEEXTRA[code_d];
1328  if (numextrabits_d != 0) {
1329  /* bits already ensured above */
1330  distance += readBits(reader, numextrabits_d);
1331  }
1332 
1333  /*part 5: fill in all the out[n] values based on the length and dist*/
1334  start = out->size;
1335  if (distance > start) ERROR_BREAK(52); /*too long backward distance*/
1336  backward = start - distance;
1337 
1338  if (!ucvector_resize(out, out->size + length)) ERROR_BREAK(83 /*alloc fail*/);
1339  if (distance < length) {
1340  size_t forward;
1341  lodepng_memcpy(out->data + start, out->data + backward, distance);
1342  start += distance;
1343  for (forward = distance; forward < length; ++forward) {
1344  out->data[start++] = out->data[backward++];
1345  }
1346  }
1347  else {
1348  lodepng_memcpy(out->data + start, out->data + backward, length);
1349  }
1350  }
1351  else if (code_ll == 256) {
1352  break; /*end code, break the loop*/
1353  }
1354  else /*if(code_ll == INVALIDSYMBOL)*/ {
1355  ERROR_BREAK(16); /*error: tried to read disallowed huffman symbol*/
1356  }
1357  /*check if any of the ensureBits above went out of bounds*/
1358  if (reader->bp > reader->bitsize) {
1359  /*return error code 10 or 11 depending on the situation that happened in huffmanDecodeSymbol
1360  (10=no endcode, 11=wrong jump outside of tree)*/
1361  /* TODO: revise error codes 10,11,50: the above comment is no longer valid */
1362  ERROR_BREAK(51); /*error, bit pointer jumps past memory*/
1363  }
1364  }
1365 
1366  HuffmanTree_cleanup(&tree_ll);
1367  HuffmanTree_cleanup(&tree_d);
1368 
1369  return error;
1370 }

References LodePNGBitReader::bitsize, LodePNGBitReader::bp, ucvector::data, DISTANCEBASE, DISTANCEEXTRA, ensureBits25(), ensureBits32(), getTreeInflateDynamic(), getTreeInflateFixed(), huffmanDecodeSymbol(), HuffmanTree_cleanup(), HuffmanTree_init(), LENGTHBASE, LENGTHEXTRA, lodepng_memcpy(), readBits(), ucvector::size, and ucvector_resize().

◆ isGrayICCProfile()

static unsigned isGrayICCProfile ( const unsigned char *  profile,
unsigned  size 
)
static

Definition at line 5901 of file lodepng.cpp.

5901  {
5902  /*
5903  It is a gray profile if bytes 16-19 are "GRAY", rgb profile if bytes 16-19
5904  are "RGB ". We do not perform any full parsing of the ICC profile here, other
5905  than check those 4 bytes to grayscale profile. Other than that, validity of
5906  the profile is not checked. This is needed only because the PNG specification
5907  requires using a non-gray color model if there is an ICC profile with "RGB "
5908  (sadly limiting compression opportunities if the input data is grayscale RGB
5909  data), and requires using a gray color model if it is "GRAY".
5910  */
5911  if (size < 20) return 0;
5912  return profile[16] == 'G' && profile[17] == 'R' && profile[18] == 'A' && profile[19] == 'Y';
5913 }

2531  {
2532  if (chunk >= end || end - chunk < 12) return end; /*too small to contain a chunk*/
2533  if (chunk[0] == 0x89 && chunk[1] == 0x50 && chunk[2] == 0x4e && chunk[3] == 0x47
2534  && chunk[4] == 0x0d && chunk[5] == 0x0a && chunk[6] == 0x1a && chunk[7] == 0x0a) {
2535  /* Is PNG magic header at start of PNG file. Jump to first actual chunk. */
2536  return chunk + 8;
2537  }

2539  size_t total_chunk_length;

2541  if (lodepng_addofl(lodepng_chunk_length(chunk), 12, &total_chunk_length)) return end;
2542  result = chunk + total_chunk_length;
2543  if (result < chunk) return end; /*pointer overflow*/
2544  return result;
2545  }
2546 }

◆ lodepng_color_mode_alloc_palette()

static void lodepng_color_mode_alloc_palette ( LodePNGColorMode *  info)
static

Definition at line 2694 of file lodepng.cpp.

2694  {
2695  size_t i;
2696  /*if the palette is already allocated, it will have size 1024 so no reallocation needed in that case*/
2697  /*the palette must have room for up to 256 colors with 4 bytes each.*/
2698  if (!info->palette) info->palette = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(1024);
2699  if (!info->palette) return; /*alloc fail*/
2700  for (i = 0; i != 256; ++i) {
2701  /*Initialize all unused colors with black, the value used for invalid palette indices.
2702  This is an error according to the PNG spec, but common PNG decoders make it black instead.
2703  That makes color conversion slightly faster due to no error handling needed.*/
2704  info->palette[i * 4 + 0] = 0;
2705  info->palette[i * 4 + 1] = 0;
2706  info->palette[i * 4 + 2] = 0;
2707  info->palette[i * 4 + 3] = 255;
2708  }
2709 }

◆ lodepng_compute_color_stats()

unsigned lodepng_compute_color_stats ( LodePNGColorStats *  stats,
const unsigned char *  in,
unsigned  w,
unsigned  h,
const LodePNGColorMode *  mode_in 
)

Definition at line 3760 of file lodepng.cpp.

3762  {
3763  size_t i;
3764  ColorTree tree;
3765  size_t numpixels = (size_t)w * (size_t)h;
3766  unsigned error = 0;
3767 
3768  /* mark things as done already if it would be impossible to have a more expensive case */
3769  unsigned colored_done = lodepng_is_greyscale_type(mode_in) ? 1 : 0;
3770  unsigned alpha_done = lodepng_can_have_alpha(mode_in) ? 0 : 1;
3771  unsigned numcolors_done = 0;
3772  unsigned bpp = lodepng_get_bpp(mode_in);
3773  unsigned bits_done = (stats->bits == 1 && bpp == 1) ? 1 : 0;
3774  unsigned sixteen = 0; /* whether the input image is 16 bit */
3775  unsigned maxnumcolors = 257;
3776  if (bpp <= 8) maxnumcolors = LODEPNG_MIN(257, stats->numcolors + (1u << bpp));
3777 
3778  stats->numpixels += numpixels;
3779 
3780  /*if palette not allowed, no need to compute numcolors*/
3781  if (!stats->allow_palette) numcolors_done = 1;
3782 
3783  color_tree_init(&tree);
3784 
3785  /*If the stats was already filled in from previous data, fill its palette in tree
3786  and mark things as done already if we know they are the most expensive case already*/
3787  if (stats->alpha) alpha_done = 1;
3788  if (stats->colored) colored_done = 1;
3789  if (stats->bits == 16) numcolors_done = 1;
3790  if (stats->bits >= bpp) bits_done = 1;
3791  if (stats->numcolors >= maxnumcolors) numcolors_done = 1;
3792 
3793  if (!numcolors_done) {
3794  for (i = 0; i < stats->numcolors; i++) {
3795  const unsigned char* color = &stats->palette[i * 4];
3796  error = color_tree_add(&tree, color[0], color[1], color[2], color[3], i);
3797  if (error) goto cleanup;
3798  }
3799  }
3800 
3801  /*Check if the 16-bit input is truly 16-bit*/
3802  if (mode_in->bitdepth == 16 && !sixteen) {
3803  unsigned short r = 0, g = 0, b = 0, a = 0;
3804  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i) {
3805  getPixelColorRGBA16(&r, &g, &b, &a, in, i, mode_in);
3806  if ((r & 255) != ((r >> 8) & 255) || (g & 255) != ((g >> 8) & 255) ||
3807  (b & 255) != ((b >> 8) & 255) || (a & 255) != ((a >> 8) & 255)) /*first and second byte differ*/ {
3808  stats->bits = 16;
3809  sixteen = 1;
3810  bits_done = 1;
3811  numcolors_done = 1; /*counting colors no longer useful, palette doesn't support 16-bit*/
3812  break;
3813  }
3814  }
3815  }
3816 
3817  if (sixteen) {
3818  unsigned short r = 0, g = 0, b = 0, a = 0;
3819 
3820  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i) {
3821  getPixelColorRGBA16(&r, &g, &b, &a, in, i, mode_in);
3822 
3823  if (!colored_done && (r != g || r != b)) {
3824  stats->colored = 1;
3825  colored_done = 1;
3826  }
3827 
3828  if (!alpha_done) {
3829  unsigned matchkey = (r == stats->key_r && g == stats->key_g && b == stats->key_b);
3830  if (a != 65535 && (a != 0 || (stats->key && !matchkey))) {
3831  stats->alpha = 1;
3832  stats->key = 0;
3833  alpha_done = 1;
3834  }
3835  else if (a == 0 && !stats->alpha && !stats->key) {
3836  stats->key = 1;
3837  stats->key_r = r;
3838  stats->key_g = g;
3839  stats->key_b = b;
3840  }
3841  else if (a == 65535 && stats->key && matchkey) {
3842  /* Color key cannot be used if an opaque pixel also has that RGB color. */
3843  stats->alpha = 1;
3844  stats->key = 0;
3845  alpha_done = 1;
3846  }
3847  }
3848  if (alpha_done && numcolors_done && colored_done && bits_done) break;
3849  }
3850 
3851  if (stats->key && !stats->alpha) {
3852  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i) {
3853  getPixelColorRGBA16(&r, &g, &b, &a, in, i, mode_in);
3854  if (a != 0 && r == stats->key_r && g == stats->key_g && b == stats->key_b) {
3855  /* Color key cannot be used if an opaque pixel also has that RGB color. */
3856  stats->alpha = 1;
3857  stats->key = 0;
3858  alpha_done = 1;
3859  }
3860  }
3861  }
3862  }
3863  else /* < 16-bit */ {
3864  unsigned char r = 0, g = 0, b = 0, a = 0;
3865  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i) {
3866  getPixelColorRGBA8(&r, &g, &b, &a, in, i, mode_in);
3867 
3868  if (!bits_done && stats->bits < 8) {
3869  /*only r is checked, < 8 bits is only relevant for grayscale*/
3870  unsigned bits = getValueRequiredBits(r);
3871  if (bits > stats->bits) stats->bits = bits;
3872  }
3873  bits_done = (stats->bits >= bpp);
3874 
3875  if (!colored_done && (r != g || r != b)) {
3876  stats->colored = 1;
3877  colored_done = 1;
3878  if (stats->bits < 8) stats->bits = 8; /*PNG has no colored modes with less than 8-bit per channel*/
3879  }
3880 
3881  if (!alpha_done) {
3882  unsigned matchkey = (r == stats->key_r && g == stats->key_g && b == stats->key_b);
3883  if (a != 255 && (a != 0 || (stats->key && !matchkey))) {
3884  stats->alpha = 1;
3885  stats->key = 0;
3886  alpha_done = 1;
3887  if (stats->bits < 8) stats->bits = 8; /*PNG has no alphachannel modes with less than 8-bit per channel*/
3888  }
3889  else if (a == 0 && !stats->alpha && !stats->key) {
3890  stats->key = 1;
3891  stats->key_r = r;
3892  stats->key_g = g;
3893  stats->key_b = b;
3894  }
3895  else if (a == 255 && stats->key && matchkey) {
3896  /* Color key cannot be used if an opaque pixel also has that RGB color. */
3897  stats->alpha = 1;
3898  stats->key = 0;
3899  alpha_done = 1;
3900  if (stats->bits < 8) stats->bits = 8; /*PNG has no alphachannel modes with less than 8-bit per channel*/
3901  }
3902  }
3903 
3904  if (!numcolors_done) {
3905  if (!color_tree_has(&tree, r, g, b, a)) {
3906  error = color_tree_add(&tree, r, g, b, a, stats->numcolors);
3907  if (error) goto cleanup;
3908  if (stats->numcolors < 256) {
3909  unsigned char* p = stats->palette;
3910  unsigned n = stats->numcolors;
3911  p[n * 4 + 0] = r;
3912  p[n * 4 + 1] = g;
3913  p[n * 4 + 2] = b;
3914  p[n * 4 + 3] = a;
3915  }
3916  ++stats->numcolors;
3917  numcolors_done = stats->numcolors >= maxnumcolors;
3918  }
3919  }
3920 
3921  if (alpha_done && numcolors_done && colored_done && bits_done) break;
3922  }
3923 
3924  if (stats->key && !stats->alpha) {
3925  for (i = 0; i != numpixels; ++i) {
3926  getPixelColorRGBA8(&r, &g, &b, &a, in, i, mode_in);
3927  if (a != 0 && r == stats->key_r && g == stats->key_g && b == stats->key_b) {
3928  /* Color key cannot be used if an opaque pixel also has that RGB color. */
3929  stats->alpha = 1;
3930  stats->key = 0;
3931  alpha_done = 1;
3932  if (stats->bits < 8) stats->bits = 8; /*PNG has no alphachannel modes with less than 8-bit per channel*/
3933  }
3934  }
3935  }
3936 
3937  /*make the stats's key always 16-bit for consistency - repeat each byte twice*/
3938  stats->key_r += (stats->key_r << 8);
3939  stats->key_g += (stats->key_g << 8);
3940  stats->key_b += (stats->key_b << 8);
3941  }
3942 
3943 cleanup:
3944  color_tree_cleanup(&tree);
3945  return error;
3946 }

3604  size_t palsize = (size_t)1u << mode_out->bitdepth;

3606  they want the values of the input color type (assuming that one is palette).

3642  }

3651  }
3652

3655  }
