Definition at line 3667 of file lodepng.cpp.

3670  {
3671  unsigned r = 0, g = 0, b = 0;
3672  unsigned mul = 65535 / ((1u << mode_in->bitdepth) - 1u); /*65535, 21845, 4369, 257, 1*/
3673  unsigned shift = 16 - mode_out->bitdepth;
3674 
3675  if (mode_in->colortype == LCT_GREY || mode_in->colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA) {
3676  r = g = b = r_in * mul;
3677  }
3678  else if (mode_in->colortype == LCT_RGB || mode_in->colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
3679  r = r_in * mul;
3680  g = g_in * mul;
3681  b = b_in * mul;
3682  }
3683  else if (mode_in->colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
3684  if (r_in >= mode_in->palettesize) return 82;
3685  r = mode_in->palette[r_in * 4 + 0] * 257u;
3686  g = mode_in->palette[r_in * 4 + 1] * 257u;
3687  b = mode_in->palette[r_in * 4 + 2] * 257u;
3688  }
3689  else {
3690  return 31;
3691  }
3692 
3693  /* now convert to output format */
3694  if (mode_out->colortype == LCT_GREY || mode_out->colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA) {
3695  *r_out = r >> shift;
3696  }
3697  else if (mode_out->colortype == LCT_RGB || mode_out->colortype == LCT_RGBA) {
3698  *r_out = r >> shift;
3699  *g_out = g >> shift;
3700  *b_out = b >> shift;
3701  }
3702  else if (mode_out->colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
3703  unsigned i;
3704  /* a 16-bit color cannot be in the palette */
3705  if ((r >> 8) != (r & 255) || (g >> 8) != (g & 255) || (b >> 8) != (b & 255)) return 82;
3706  for (i = 0; i < mode_out->palettesize; i++) {
3707  unsigned j = i * 4;
3708  if ((r >> 8) == mode_out->palette[j + 0] && (g >> 8) == mode_out->palette[j + 1] &&
3709  (b >> 8) == mode_out->palette[j + 2]) {
3710  *r_out = i;
3711  return 0;
3712  }
3713  }
3714  return 82;
3715  }
3716  else {
3717  return 31;
3718  }
3719 
3720  return 0;
3721 }

2103 
2104  LodePNGBitWriter_init(&writer, out);
2105

2107  else if (settings->btype == 0) return deflateNoCompression(out, in, insize);
2108  else if (settings->btype == 1) blocksize = insize;
2109  else /*if(settings->btype == 2)*/ {
2110  /*on PNGs, deflate blocks of 65-262k seem to give most dense encoding*/
2111  blocksize = insize / 8u + 8;
2112  if (blocksize < 65536) blocksize = 65536;
2113  if (blocksize > 262144) blocksize = 262144;
2114  }

2123  unsigned final = (i == numdeflateblocks - 1);
2124  size_t start = i * blocksize;
2125  size_t end = start + blocksize;
2126  if (end > insize) end = insize;
2127 
2128  if (settings->btype == 1) error = deflateFixed(&writer, &hash, in, start, end, settings, final);
2129  else if (settings->btype == 2) error = deflateDynamic(&writer, &hash, in, start, end, settings, final);
2130  }
2131  }
2132

2134 
2135  return error;
2136 }

5925  unsigned char* data = 0; /*uncompressed version of the IDAT chunk data*/
5926  size_t datasize = 0;
5927  ucvector outv = ucvector_init(NULL, 0);
5928  LodePNGInfo info;
5929  const LodePNGInfo* info_png = &state->info_png;
5930 
5931  lodepng_info_init(&info);
5932 
5933  /*provide some proper output values if error will happen*/
5934  *out = 0;
5935  *outsize = 0;
5936  state->error = 0;
5937 
5938  /*check input values validity*/
5939  if ((info_png->color.colortype == LCT_PALETTE || state->encoder.force_palette)
5940  && (info_png->color.palettesize == 0 || info_png->color.palettesize > 256)) {
5941  state->error = 68; /*invalid palette size, it is only allowed to be 1-256*/
5942  goto cleanup;
5943  }
5944  if (state->encoder.zlibsettings.btype > 2) {
5945  state->error = 61; /*error: invalid btype*/
5946  goto cleanup;
5947  }
5948  if (info_png->interlace_method > 1) {
5949  state->error = 71; /*error: invalid interlace mode*/
5950  goto cleanup;
5951  }
5952  state->error = checkColorValidity(info_png->color.colortype, info_png->color.bitdepth);
5953  if (state->error) goto cleanup; /*error: invalid color type given*/
5954  state->error = checkColorValidity(state->info_raw.colortype, state->info_raw.bitdepth);
5955  if (state->error) goto cleanup; /*error: invalid color type given*/
5956 
5957  /* color convert and compute scanline filter types */
5958  lodepng_info_copy(&info, &state->info_png);
5959  if (state->encoder.auto_convert) {
5960  LodePNGColorStats stats;
5961  lodepng_color_stats_init(&stats);
5962 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
5963  if (info_png->iccp_defined &&
5964  isGrayICCProfile(info_png->iccp_profile, info_png->iccp_profile_size)) {
5965  /*the PNG specification does not allow to use palette with a GRAY ICC profile, even
5966  if the palette has only gray colors, so disallow it.*/
5967  stats.allow_palette = 0;
5968  }
5969  if (info_png->iccp_defined &&
5970  isRGBICCProfile(info_png->iccp_profile, info_png->iccp_profile_size)) {
5971  /*the PNG specification does not allow to use grayscale color with RGB ICC profile, so disallow gray.*/
5972  stats.allow_greyscale = 0;
5973  }
5974 #endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS */
5975  state->error = lodepng_compute_color_stats(&stats, image, w, h, &state->info_raw);
5976  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
5977 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
5978  if (info_png->background_defined) {
5979  /*the background chunk's color must be taken into account as well*/
5980  unsigned r = 0, g = 0, b = 0;
5981  LodePNGColorMode mode16 = lodepng_color_mode_make(LCT_RGB, 16);
5982  lodepng_convert_rgb(&r, &g, &b, info_png->background_r, info_png->background_g, info_png->background_b, &mode16, &info_png->color);
5983  state->error = lodepng_color_stats_add(&stats, r, g, b, 65535);
5984  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
5985  }
5986 #endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS */
5987  state->error = auto_choose_color(&info.color, &state->info_raw, &stats);
5988  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
5989 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
5990  /*also convert the background chunk*/
5991  if (info_png->background_defined) {
5992  if (lodepng_convert_rgb(&info.background_r, &info.background_g, &info.background_b,
5993  info_png->background_r, info_png->background_g, info_png->background_b, &info.color, &info_png->color)) {
5994  state->error = 104;
5995  goto cleanup;
5996  }
5997  }
5998 #endif /* LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS */
5999  }
6000 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
6001  if (info_png->iccp_defined) {
6002  unsigned gray_icc = isGrayICCProfile(info_png->iccp_profile, info_png->iccp_profile_size);
6003  unsigned rgb_icc = isRGBICCProfile(info_png->iccp_profile, info_png->iccp_profile_size);
6004  unsigned gray_png = info.color.colortype == LCT_GREY || info.color.colortype == LCT_GREY_ALPHA;
6005  if (!gray_icc && !rgb_icc) {
6006  state->error = 100; /* Disallowed profile color type for PNG */
6007  goto cleanup;
6008  }
6009  if (gray_icc != gray_png) {
6010  /*Not allowed to use RGB/RGBA/palette with GRAY ICC profile or vice versa,
6011  or in case of auto_convert, it wasn't possible to find appropriate model*/
6012  state->error = state->encoder.auto_convert ? 102 : 101;
6013  goto cleanup;
6014  }
6015  }
6016 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
6017  if (!lodepng_color_mode_equal(&state->info_raw, &info.color)) {
6018  unsigned char* converted;
6019  size_t size = ((size_t)w * (size_t)h * (size_t)lodepng_get_bpp(&info.color) + 7u) / 8u;
6020 
6021  converted = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(size);
6022  if (!converted && size) state->error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
6023  if (!state->error) {
6024  state->error = lodepng_convert(converted, image, &info.color, &state->info_raw, w, h);
6025  }
6026  if (!state->error) {
6027  state->error = preProcessScanlines(&data, &datasize, converted, w, h, &info, &state->encoder);
6028  }
6029  lodepng_free(converted);
6030  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6031  }
6032  else {
6033  state->error = preProcessScanlines(&data, &datasize, image, w, h, &info, &state->encoder);
6034  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6035  }
6036 
6037  /* output all PNG chunks */ {
6038 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
6039  size_t i;
6040 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
6041  /*write signature and chunks*/
6042  state->error = writeSignature(&outv);
6043  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6044  /*IHDR*/
6045  state->error = addChunk_IHDR(&outv, w, h, info.color.colortype, info.color.bitdepth, info.interlace_method);
6046  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6047 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
6048  /*unknown chunks between IHDR and PLTE*/
6049  if (info.unknown_chunks_data[0]) {
6050  state->error = addUnknownChunks(&outv, info.unknown_chunks_data[0], info.unknown_chunks_size[0]);
6051  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6052  }
6053  /*color profile chunks must come before PLTE */
6054  if (info.iccp_defined) {
6055  state->error = addChunk_iCCP(&outv, &info, &state->encoder.zlibsettings);
6056  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6057  }
6058  if (info.srgb_defined) {
6059  state->error = addChunk_sRGB(&outv, &info);
6060  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6061  }
6062  if (info.gama_defined) {
6063  state->error = addChunk_gAMA(&outv, &info);
6064  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6065  }
6066  if (info.chrm_defined) {
6067  state->error = addChunk_cHRM(&outv, &info);
6068  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6069  }
6070 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
6071  /*PLTE*/
6072  if (info.color.colortype == LCT_PALETTE) {
6073  state->error = addChunk_PLTE(&outv, &info.color);
6074  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6075  }
6076  if (state->encoder.force_palette && (info.color.colortype == LCT_RGB || info.color.colortype == LCT_RGBA)) {
6077  /*force_palette means: write suggested palette for truecolor in PLTE chunk*/
6078  state->error = addChunk_PLTE(&outv, &info.color);
6079  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6080  }
6081  /*tRNS (this will only add if when necessary) */
6082  state->error = addChunk_tRNS(&outv, &info.color);
6083  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6084 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
6085  /*bKGD (must come between PLTE and the IDAt chunks*/
6086  if (info.background_defined) {
6087  state->error = addChunk_bKGD(&outv, &info);
6088  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6089  }
6090  /*pHYs (must come before the IDAT chunks)*/
6091  if (info.phys_defined) {
6092  state->error = addChunk_pHYs(&outv, &info);
6093  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6094  }
6095 
6096  /*unknown chunks between PLTE and IDAT*/
6097  if (info.unknown_chunks_data[1]) {
6098  state->error = addUnknownChunks(&outv, info.unknown_chunks_data[1], info.unknown_chunks_size[1]);
6099  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6100  }
6101 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
6102  /*IDAT (multiple IDAT chunks must be consecutive)*/
6103  state->error = addChunk_IDAT(&outv, data, datasize, &state->encoder.zlibsettings);
6104  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6105 #ifdef LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS
6106  /*tIME*/
6107  if (info.time_defined) {
6108  state->error = addChunk_tIME(&outv, &info.time);
6109  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6110  }
6111  /*tEXt and/or zTXt*/
6112  for (i = 0; i != info.text_num; ++i) {
6113  if (lodepng_strlen(info.text_keys[i]) > 79) {
6114  state->error = 66; /*text chunk too large*/
6115  goto cleanup;
6116  }
6117  if (lodepng_strlen(info.text_keys[i]) < 1) {
6118  state->error = 67; /*text chunk too small*/
6119  goto cleanup;
6120  }
6121  if (state->encoder.text_compression) {
6122  state->error = addChunk_zTXt(&outv, info.text_keys[i], info.text_strings[i], &state->encoder.zlibsettings);
6123  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6124  }
6125  else {
6126  state->error = addChunk_tEXt(&outv, info.text_keys[i], info.text_strings[i]);
6127  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6128  }
6129  }
6130  /*LodePNG version id in text chunk*/
6131  if (state->encoder.add_id) {
6132  unsigned already_added_id_text = 0;
6133  for (i = 0; i != info.text_num; ++i) {
6134  const char* k = info.text_keys[i];
6135  /* Could use strcmp, but we're not calling or reimplementing this C library function for this use only */
6136  if (k[0] == 'L' && k[1] == 'o' && k[2] == 'd' && k[3] == 'e' &&
6137  k[4] == 'P' && k[5] == 'N' && k[6] == 'G' && k[7] == '\0') {
6138  already_added_id_text = 1;
6139  break;
6140  }
6141  }
6142  if (already_added_id_text == 0) {
6143  state->error = addChunk_tEXt(&outv, "LodePNG", LODEPNG_VERSION_STRING); /*it's shorter as tEXt than as zTXt chunk*/
6144  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6145  }
6146  }
6147  /*iTXt*/
6148  for (i = 0; i != info.itext_num; ++i) {
6149  if (lodepng_strlen(info.itext_keys[i]) > 79) {
6150  state->error = 66; /*text chunk too large*/
6151  goto cleanup;
6152  }
6153  if (lodepng_strlen(info.itext_keys[i]) < 1) {
6154  state->error = 67; /*text chunk too small*/
6155  goto cleanup;
6156  }
6157  state->error = addChunk_iTXt(
6158  &outv, state->encoder.text_compression,
6159  info.itext_keys[i], info.itext_langtags[i], info.itext_transkeys[i], info.itext_strings[i],
6160  &state->encoder.zlibsettings);
6161  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6162  }
6163 
6164  /*unknown chunks between IDAT and IEND*/
6165  if (info.unknown_chunks_data[2]) {
6166  state->error = addUnknownChunks(&outv, info.unknown_chunks_data[2], info.unknown_chunks_size[2]);
6167  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6168  }
6169 #endif /*LODEPNG_COMPILE_ANCILLARY_CHUNKS*/
6170  state->error = addChunk_IEND(&outv);
6171  if (state->error) goto cleanup;
6172  }
6173 
6174 cleanup:
6175  lodepng_info_cleanup(&info);
6176  lodepng_free(data);
6177 
6178  /*instead of cleaning the vector up, give it to the output*/
6179  *out = outv.data;
6180  *outsize = outv.size;
6181 
6182  return state->error;
6183 }

References addChunk_bKGD(), addChunk_cHRM(), addChunk_gAMA(), addChunk_iCCP(), addChunk_IDAT(), addChunk_IEND(), addChunk_IHDR(), addChunk_iTXt(), addChunk_pHYs(), addChunk_PLTE(), addChunk_sRGB(), addChunk_tEXt(), addChunk_tIME(), addChunk_tRNS(), addChunk_zTXt(), addUnknownChunks(), auto_choose_color(), checkColorValidity(), ucvector::data, isGrayICCProfile(), isRGBICCProfile(), lodepng_color_mode_equal(), lodepng_color_mode_make(), lodepng_color_stats_add(), lodepng_color_stats_init(), lodepng_compute_color_stats(), lodepng_convert(), lodepng_convert_rgb(), lodepng_free(), lodepng_get_bpp(), lodepng_info_cleanup(), lodepng_info_copy(), lodepng_info_init(), lodepng_malloc(), lodepng_strlen(), LODEPNG_VERSION_STRING, preProcessScanlines(), ucvector::size, ucvector_init(), and writeSignature().

◆ lodepng_filesize()

static long lodepng_filesize ( const char *  filename)
static

Definition at line 344 of file lodepng.cpp.

344  {
345  FILE* file;
346  long size;
347  file = fopen(filename, "rb");
348  if (!file) return -1;
349 
350  if (fseek(file, 0, SEEK_END) != 0) {
351  fclose(file);
352  return -1;
353  }
354 
355  size = ftell(file);
356  /* It may give LONG_MAX as directory size, this is invalid for us. */
357  if (size == LONG_MAX) size = -1;

360  return size;

◆ lodepng_get_raw_size_idat()

static size_t lodepng_get_raw_size_idat ( unsigned  w,
unsigned  h,
unsigned  bpp 
)

2825  {
2826  /* + 1 for the filter byte, and possibly plus padding bits per line. */
2827  /* Ignoring casts, the expression is equal to (w * bpp + 7) / 8 + 1, but avoids overflow of w * bpp */
2828  size_t line = ((size_t)(w / 8u) * bpp) + 1u + ((w & 7u) * bpp + 7u) / 8u;
2829  return (size_t)h * line;
2830 }

◆ lodepng_huffman_code_lengths()

unsigned lodepng_huffman_code_lengths ( unsigned *  lengths,
const unsigned *  frequencies,
size_t  numcodes,
unsigned  maxbitlen 
)

Definition at line 974 of file lodepng.cpp.

975  {
976  unsigned error = 0;
977  unsigned i;
978  size_t numpresent = 0; /*number of symbols with non-zero frequency*/
979  BPMNode* leaves; /*the symbols, only those with > 0 frequency*/
980 
981  if (numcodes == 0) return 80; /*error: a tree of 0 symbols is not supposed to be made*/
982  if ((1u << maxbitlen) < (unsigned)numcodes) return 80; /*error: represent all symbols*/
983 
984  leaves = (BPMNode*)lodepng_malloc(numcodes * sizeof(*leaves));
985  if (!leaves) return 83; /*alloc fail*/
986 
987  for (i = 0; i != numcodes; ++i) {
988  if (frequencies[i] > 0) {
989  leaves[numpresent].weight = (int)frequencies[i];
990  leaves[numpresent].index = i;
991  ++numpresent;
992  }
993  }
994 
995  lodepng_memset(lengths, 0, numcodes * sizeof(*lengths));
996 
997  /*ensure at least two present symbols. There should be at least one symbol
998  according to RFC 1951 section 3.2.7. Some decoders incorrectly require two. To
999  make these work as well ensure there are at least two symbols. The
1000  Package-Merge code below also doesn't work correctly if there's only one
1001  symbol, it'd give it the theoretical 0 bits but in practice zlib wants 1 bit*/
1002  if (numpresent == 0) {
1003  lengths[0] = lengths[1] = 1; /*note that for RFC 1951 section 3.2.7, only lengths[0] = 1 is needed*/
1004  }
1005  else if (numpresent == 1) {
1006  lengths[leaves[0].index] = 1;
1007  lengths[leaves[0].index == 0 ? 1 : 0] = 1;
1008  }
1009  else {
1010  BPMLists lists;
1011  BPMNode* node;
1012 
1013  bpmnode_sort(leaves, numpresent);
1014 
1015  lists.listsize = maxbitlen;
1016  lists.memsize = 2 * maxbitlen * (maxbitlen + 1);
1017  lists.nextfree = 0;
1018  lists.numfree = lists.memsize;
1019  lists.memory = (BPMNode*)lodepng_malloc(lists.memsize * sizeof(*lists.memory));
1020  lists.freelist = (BPMNode**)lodepng_malloc(lists.memsize * sizeof(BPMNode*));
1021  lists.chains0 = (BPMNode**)lodepng_malloc(lists.listsize * sizeof(BPMNode*));
1022  lists.chains1 = (BPMNode**)lodepng_malloc(lists.listsize * sizeof(BPMNode*));
1023  if (!lists.memory || !lists.freelist || !lists.chains0 || !lists.chains1) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
1024 
1025  if (!error) {
1026  for (i = 0; i != lists.memsize; ++i) lists.freelist[i] = &lists.memory[i];
1027 
1028  bpmnode_create(&lists, leaves[0].weight, 1, 0);
1029  bpmnode_create(&lists, leaves[1].weight, 2, 0);
1030 
1031  for (i = 0; i != lists.listsize; ++i) {
1032  lists.chains0[i] = &lists.memory[0];
1033  lists.chains1[i] = &lists.memory[1];
1034  }
1035 
1036  /*each boundaryPM call adds one chain to the last list, and we need 2 * numpresent - 2 chains.*/
1037  for (i = 2; i != 2 * numpresent - 2; ++i) boundaryPM(&lists, leaves, numpresent, (int)maxbitlen - 1, (int)i);
1038 
1039  for (node = lists.chains1[maxbitlen - 1]; node; node = node->tail) {
1040  for (i = 0; i != node->index; ++i) ++lengths[leaves[i].index];
1041  }
1042  }
1043 
1044  lodepng_free(lists.memory);
1045  lodepng_free(lists.freelist);
1046  lodepng_free(lists.chains0);
1047  lodepng_free(lists.chains1);
1048  }
1049 
1050  lodepng_free(leaves);
1051  return error;
1052 }

References boundaryPM(), bpmnode_create(), bpmnode_sort(), BPMLists::chains0, BPMLists::chains1, BPMLists::freelist, BPMNode::index, BPMLists::listsize, lodepng_free(), lodepng_malloc(), lodepng_memset(), BPMLists::memory, BPMLists::memsize, BPMLists::nextfree, BPMLists::numfree, BPMNode::tail, and BPMNode::weight.

4112  {
4113  unsigned width, height;
4114  LodePNGInfo* info = &state->info_png;
4115  if (insize == 0 || in == 0) {
4116  CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 48); /*error: the given data is empty*/
4117  }
4118  if (insize < 33) {
4119  CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 27); /*error: the data length is smaller than the length of a PNG header*/
4120  }
4121 
4122  /*when decoding a new PNG image, make sure all parameters created after previous decoding are reset*/
4123  /* TODO: remove this. One should use a new LodePNGState for new sessions */
4124  lodepng_info_cleanup(info);
4125  lodepng_info_init(info);
4126 
4127  if (in[0] != 137 || in[1] != 80 || in[2] != 78 || in[3] != 71
4128  || in[4] != 13 || in[5] != 10 || in[6] != 26 || in[7] != 10) {
4129  CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 28); /*error: the first 8 bytes are not the correct PNG signature*/
4130  }
4131  if (lodepng_chunk_length(in + 8) != 13) {
4132  CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 94); /*error: header size must be 13 bytes*/
4133  }
4134  if (!lodepng_chunk_type_equals(in + 8, "IHDR")) {
4135  CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 29); /*error: it doesn't start with a IHDR chunk!*/
4136  }
4137 
4138  /*read the values given in the header*/
4139  width = lodepng_read32bitInt(&in[16]);
4140  height = lodepng_read32bitInt(&in[20]);
4141  /*TODO: remove the undocumented feature that allows to give null pointers to width or height*/
4142  if (w) *w = width;
4143  if (h) *h = height;
4144  info->color.bitdepth = in[24];
4145  info->color.colortype = (LodePNGColorType)in[25];
4146  info->compression_method = in[26];
4147  info->filter_method = in[27];
4148  info->interlace_method = in[28];
4149 
4150  /*errors returned only after the parsing so other values are still output*/
4151 
4152  /*error: invalid image size*/
4153  if (width == 0 || height == 0) CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 93);
4154  /*error: invalid colortype or bitdepth combination*/
4155  state->error = checkColorValidity(info->color.colortype, info->color.bitdepth);
4156  if (state->error) return state->error;
4157  /*error: only compression method 0 is allowed in the specification*/
4158  if (info->compression_method != 0) CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 32);
4159  /*error: only filter method 0 is allowed in the specification*/
4160  if (info->filter_method != 0) CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 33);
4161  /*error: only interlace methods 0 and 1 exist in the specification*/
4162  if (info->interlace_method > 1) CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 34);
4163 
4164  if (!state->decoder.ignore_crc) {
4165  unsigned CRC = lodepng_read32bitInt(&in[29]);
4166  unsigned checksum = lodepng_crc32(&in[12], 17);
4167  if (CRC != checksum) {
4168  CERROR_RETURN_ERROR(state->error, 57); /*invalid CRC*/
4169  }
4170  }
4171 
4172  return state->error;
4173 }

◆ lodepng_pixel_overflow()

static int lodepng_pixel_overflow ( unsigned  w,

)
static

Definition at line 2841 of file lodepng.cpp.

2842  {
2843  size_t bpp = LODEPNG_MAX(lodepng_get_bpp(pngcolor), lodepng_get_bpp(rawcolor));
2844  size_t numpixels, total;
2845  size_t line; /* bytes per line in worst case */
2846 
2847  if (lodepng_mulofl((size_t)w, (size_t)h, &numpixels)) return 1;
2848  if (lodepng_mulofl(numpixels, 8, &total)) return 1; /* bit pointer with 8-bit color, or 8 bytes per channel color */
2849 
2850  /* Bytes per scanline with the expression "(w / 8u) * bpp) + ((w & 7u) * bpp + 7u) / 8u" */
2851  if (lodepng_mulofl((size_t)(w / 8u), bpp, &line)) return 1;
2852  if (lodepng_addofl(line, ((w & 7u) * bpp + 7u) / 8u, &line)) return 1;
2853 
2854  if (lodepng_addofl(line, 5, &line)) return 1; /* 5 bytes overhead per line: 1 filterbyte, 4 for Adam7 worst case */
2855  if (lodepng_mulofl(line, h, &total)) return 1; /* Total bytes in worst case */
2856 
2857  return 0; /* no overflow */
2858 }

2280

2283  if (!error) {
2284  *outsize = deflatesize + 6;
2285  *out = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(*outsize);
2286  if (!*out) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
2287  }
2288 
2289  if (!error) {
2290  unsigned ADLER32 = adler32(in, (unsigned)insize);
2291  /*zlib data: 1 byte CMF (CM+CINFO), 1 byte FLG, deflate data, 4 byte ADLER32 checksum of the Decompressed data*/
2292  unsigned CMF = 120; /*0b01111000: CM 8, CINFO 7. With CINFO 7, any window size up to 32768 can be used.*/
2293  unsigned FLEVEL = 0;
2294  unsigned FDICT = 0;
2295  unsigned CMFFLG = 256 * CMF + FDICT * 32 + FLEVEL * 64;
2296  unsigned FCHECK = 31 - CMFFLG % 31;
2297  CMFFLG += FCHECK;
2298 
2299  (*out)[0] = (unsigned char)(CMFFLG >> 8);
2300  (*out)[1] = (unsigned char)(CMFFLG & 255);
2301  for (i = 0; i != deflatesize; ++i) (*out)[i + 2] = deflatedata[i];
2302  lodepng_set32bitInt(&(*out)[*outsize - 4], ADLER32);
2303  }
2304 
2305  lodepng_free(deflatedata);
2306  return error;
2307 }

2199  unsigned error = 0;
2200  unsigned CM, CINFO, FDICT;
2201 
2202  if (insize < 2) return 53; /*error, size of zlib data too small*/
2203  /*read information from zlib header*/
2204  if ((in[0] * 256 + in[1]) % 31 != 0) {
2205  /*error: 256 * in[0] + in[1] must be a multiple of 31, the FCHECK value is supposed to be made that way*/
2206  return 24;
2207  }

2210  CINFO = (in[0] >> 4) & 15;

2213  /*FLEVEL = (in[1] >> 6) & 3;*/ /*FLEVEL is not used here*/

2216  /*error: only compression method 8: inflate with sliding window of 32k is supported by the PNG spec*/

2232  }
2233 
2234  return 0; /*no error*/
2235 }

4050  short pb = LODEPNG_ABS(a - c);
4051  short pc = LODEPNG_ABS(a + b - c - c);
4052  /* return input value associated with smallest of pa, pb, pc (with certain priority if equal) */

4054  return (pc < pa) ? c : a;
4055 }

Referenced by huffmanDecodeSymbol(), and readBits().

Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ postProcessScanlines()

static unsigned postProcessScanlines ( unsigned char *  out,
unsigned char *  in,
unsigned  w,
unsigned  h,
const LodePNGInfo *  info_png 
)
static

Definition at line 4386 of file lodepng.cpp.

4387  {
4388  /*
4389  This function converts the filtered-padded-interlaced data into pure 2D image buffer with the PNG's colortype.
4390  Steps:
4391  *) if no Adam7: 1) unfilter 2) remove padding bits (= possible extra bits per scanline if bpp < 8)
4392  *) if adam7: 1) 7x unfilter 2) 7x remove padding bits 3) Adam7_deinterlace
4393  NOTE: the in buffer will be overwritten with intermediate data!
4394  */
4395  unsigned bpp = lodepng_get_bpp(&info_png->color);
4396  if (bpp == 0) return 31; /*error: invalid colortype*/
4397 
4398  if (info_png->interlace_method == 0) {
4399  if (bpp < 8 && w * bpp != ((w * bpp + 7u) / 8u) * 8u) {
4400  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(unfilter(in, in, w, h, bpp));
4401  removePaddingBits(out, in, w * bpp, ((w * bpp + 7u) / 8u) * 8u, h);
4402  }
4403  /*we can immediately filter into the out buffer, no other steps needed*/
4404  else CERROR_TRY_RETURN(unfilter(out, in, w, h, bpp));
4405  }
4406  else /*interlace_method is 1 (Adam7)*/ {
4407  unsigned passw[7], passh[7]; size_t filter_passstart[8], padded_passstart[8], passstart[8];
4408  unsigned i;
4409 
4410  Adam7_getpassvalues(passw, passh, filter_passstart, padded_passstart, passstart, w, h, bpp);
4411 
4412  for (i = 0; i != 7; ++i) {
4413  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(unfilter(&in[padded_passstart[i]], &in[filter_passstart[i]], passw[i], passh[i], bpp));
4414  /*TODO: possible efficiency improvement: if in this reduced image the bits fit nicely in 1 scanline,
4415  move bytes instead of bits or move not at all*/
4416  if (bpp < 8) {
4417  /*remove padding bits in scanlines; after this there still may be padding
4418  bits between the different reduced images: each reduced image still starts nicely at a byte*/
4419  removePaddingBits(&in[passstart[i]], &in[padded_passstart[i]], passw[i] * bpp,
4420  ((passw[i] * bpp + 7u) / 8u) * 8u, passh[i]);
4421  }
4422  }
4423 
4424  Adam7_deinterlace(out, in, w, h, bpp);
4425  }
4426 
4427  return 0;
4428 }

References Adam7_deinterlace(), Adam7_getpassvalues(), lodepng_get_bpp(), removePaddingBits(), and unfilter().

Referenced by decodeGeneric().

Here is the call graph for this function:
Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ preProcessScanlines()

static unsigned preProcessScanlines ( unsigned char **  out,
size_t *  outsize,
const unsigned char *  in,
unsigned  w,
unsigned  h,
const LodePNGInfo *  info_png,
const LodePNGEncoderSettings *  settings 
)
static

Definition at line 5814 of file lodepng.cpp.

5816  {
5817  /*
5818  This function converts the pure 2D image with the PNG's colortype, into filtered-padded-interlaced data. Steps:
5819  *) if no Adam7: 1) add padding bits (= possible extra bits per scanline if bpp < 8) 2) filter
5820  *) if adam7: 1) Adam7_interlace 2) 7x add padding bits 3) 7x filter
5821  */
5822  unsigned bpp = lodepng_get_bpp(&info_png->color);
5823  unsigned error = 0;
5824 
5825  if (info_png->interlace_method == 0) {
5826  *outsize = h + (h * ((w * bpp + 7u) / 8u)); /*image size plus an extra byte per scanline + possible padding bits*/
5827  *out = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(*outsize);
5828  if (!(*out) && (*outsize)) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5829 
5830  if (!error) {
5831  /*non multiple of 8 bits per scanline, padding bits needed per scanline*/
5832  if (bpp < 8 && w * bpp != ((w * bpp + 7u) / 8u) * 8u) {
5833  unsigned char* padded = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(h * ((w * bpp + 7u) / 8u));
5834  if (!padded) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5835  if (!error) {
5836  addPaddingBits(padded, in, ((w * bpp + 7u) / 8u) * 8u, w * bpp, h);
5837  error = filter(*out, padded, w, h, &info_png->color, settings);
5838  }
5839  lodepng_free(padded);
5840  }
5841  else {
5842  /*we can immediately filter into the out buffer, no other steps needed*/
5843  error = filter(*out, in, w, h, &info_png->color, settings);
5844  }
5845  }
5846  }
5847  else /*interlace_method is 1 (Adam7)*/ {
5848  unsigned passw[7], passh[7];
5849  size_t filter_passstart[8], padded_passstart[8], passstart[8];
5850  unsigned char* adam7;
5851 
5852  Adam7_getpassvalues(passw, passh, filter_passstart, padded_passstart, passstart, w, h, bpp);
5853 
5854  *outsize = filter_passstart[7]; /*image size plus an extra byte per scanline + possible padding bits*/
5855  *out = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(*outsize);
5856  if (!(*out)) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5857 
5858  adam7 = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(passstart[7]);
5859  if (!adam7 && passstart[7]) error = 83; /*alloc fail*/
5860 
5861  if (!error) {
5862  unsigned i;
5863 
5864  Adam7_interlace(adam7, in, w, h, bpp);
5865  for (i = 0; i != 7; ++i) {
5866  if (bpp < 8) {
5867  unsigned char* padded = (unsigned char*)lodepng_malloc(padded_passstart[i + 1] - padded_passstart[i]);
5868  if (!padded) ERROR_BREAK(83); /*alloc fail*/
5869  addPaddingBits(padded, &adam7[passstart[i]],
5870  ((passw[i] * bpp + 7u) / 8u) * 8u, passw[i] * bpp, passh[i]);
5871  error = filter(&(*out)[filter_passstart[i]], padded,
5872  passw[i], passh[i], &info_png->color, settings);
5873  lodepng_free(padded);
5874  }
5875  else {
5876  error = filter(&(*out)[filter_passstart[i]], &adam7[padded_passstart[i]],
5877  passw[i], passh[i], &info_png->color, settings);
5878  }
5879 
5880  if (error) break;
5881  }
5882  }
5883 
5884  lodepng_free(adam7);
5885  }
5886 
5887  return error;
5888 }

4605

4607  /*Quick check if the chunk length isn't too small. Even without check
4608  it'd still fail with other error checks below if it's too short. This just gives a different error code.*/
4609  if (chunkLength < 5) CERROR_BREAK(error, 30); /*iTXt chunk too short*/
4610

4612  for (length = 0; length < chunkLength && data[length] != 0; ++length);
4613  if (length + 3 >= chunkLength) CERROR_BREAK(error, 75); /*no null termination char, corrupt?*/

4617  if (!key) CERROR_BREAK(error, 83); /*alloc fail*/

4620  key[length] = 0;
4621 
4622  /*read the compression method*/

4624  if (data[length + 2] != 0) CERROR_BREAK(error, 72); /*the 0 byte indicating compression must be 0*/
4625

4627  there's no null termination char, if the text is empty for the next 3 texts*/
4628

4642  length = 0;
4643  for (i = begin; i < chunkLength && data[i] != 0; ++i) ++length;

4646  if (!transkey) CERROR_BREAK(error, 83); /*alloc fail*/
4647

4649  transkey[length] = 0;
4650

4652  begin += length + 1;
4653 
4654  length = (unsigned)chunkLength < begin ? 0 : (unsigned)chunkLength - begin;
4655

4657  unsigned char* str = 0;
4658  size_t size = 0;
4659  /*will fail if zlib error, e.g. if length is too small*/

4661  length, zlibsettings);
4662  if (!error) error = lodepng_add_itext_sized(info, key, langtag, transkey, (char*)str, size);
4663  lodepng_free(str);
4664  }
4665  else {

4667  }
4668

4670  }
4671

4673  lodepng_free(langtag);
4674  lodepng_free(transkey);
4675 
4676  return error;
4677 }

4571  if (!key) CERROR_BREAK(error, 83); /*alloc fail*/
4572 
4573  lodepng_memcpy(key, data, length);
4574  key[length] = 0;
4575 
4576  if (data[length + 1] != 0) CERROR_BREAK(error, 72); /*the 0 byte indicating compression must be 0*/
4577 
4578  string2_begin = length + 2;
4579  if (string2_begin > chunkLength) CERROR_BREAK(error, 75); /*no null termination, corrupt?*/
4580 
4581  length = (unsigned)chunkLength - string2_begin;
4582  /*will fail if zlib error, e.g. if length is too small*/
4583  error = zlib_decompress(&str, &size, 0, &data[string2_begin],
4584  length, zlibsettings);
4585  if (error) break;
4586  error = lodepng_add_text_sized(info, key, (char*)str, size);
4587 
4588  break;
4589  }
4590 
4591  lodepng_free(key);
4592  lodepng_free(str);
4593 
4594  return error;
4595 }

References lodepng_add_text_sized(), lodepng_free(), lodepng_malloc(), lodepng_memcpy(), and zlib_decompress().

◆ removePaddingBits()

static void removePaddingBits ( unsigned char *  out,
const unsigned char *  in,
size_t  olinebits,
size_t  ilinebits,
unsigned  h 
)
static

Definition at line 4359 of file lodepng.cpp.

4360  {
4361  /*
4362  After filtering there are still padding bits if scanlines have non multiple of 8 bit amounts. They need
4363  to be removed (except at last scanline of (Adam7-reduced) image) before working with pure image buffers
4364  for the Adam7 code, the color convert code and the output to the user.
4365  in and out are allowed to be the same buffer, in may also be higher but still overlapping; in must
4366  have >= ilinebits*h bits, out must have >= olinebits*h bits, olinebits must be <= ilinebits
4367  also used to move bits after earlier such operations happened, e.g. in a sequence of reduced images from Adam7
4368  only useful if (ilinebits - olinebits) is a value in the range 1..7
4369  */
4370  unsigned y;
4371  size_t diff = ilinebits - olinebits;
4372  size_t ibp = 0, obp = 0; /*input and output bit pointers*/
4373  for (y = 0; y < h; ++y) {
4374  size_t x;
4375  for (x = 0; x < olinebits; ++x) {
4376  unsigned char bit = readBitFromReversedStream(&ibp, in);
4377  setBitOfReversedStream(&obp, out, bit);
4378  }
4379  ibp += diff;
4380  }
4381 }

◆ unfilter()

static unsigned unfilter ( unsigned char *  out,
const unsigned char *  in,
unsigned  w,
unsigned  h,
unsigned  bpp 
)
static

Definition at line 4277 of file lodepng.cpp.

4277  {
4278  /*
4279  For PNG filter method 0
4280  this function unfilters a single image (e.g. without interlacing this is called once, with Adam7 seven times)
4281  out must have enough bytes allocated already, in must have the scanlines + 1 filtertype byte per scanline
4282  w and h are image dimensions or dimensions of reduced image, bpp is bits per pixel
4283  in and out are allowed to be the same memory address (but aren't the same size since in has the extra filter bytes)
4284  */
4285 
4286  unsigned y;
4287  unsigned char* prevline = 0;
4288 
4289  /*bytewidth is used for filtering, is 1 when bpp < 8, number of bytes per pixel otherwise*/
4290  size_t bytewidth = (bpp + 7u) / 8u;
4291  /*the width of a scanline in bytes, not including the filter type*/
4292  size_t linebytes = lodepng_get_raw_size_idat(w, 1, bpp) - 1u;
4293 
4294  for (y = 0; y < h; ++y) {
4295  size_t outindex = linebytes * y;
4296  size_t inindex = (1 + linebytes) * y; /*the extra filterbyte added to each row*/
4297  unsigned char filterType = in[inindex];
4298 
4299  CERROR_TRY_RETURN(unfilterScanline(&out[outindex], &in[inindex + 1], prevline, bytewidth, filterType, linebytes));
4300 
4301  prevline = &out[outindex];
4302  }
4303 
4304  return 0;
4305 }

References lodepng_get_raw_size_idat(), and unfilterScanline().

Referenced by postProcessScanlines().

Here is the call graph for this function:
Here is the caller graph for this function:

◆ unfilterScanline()

static unsigned unfilterScanline ( unsigned char *  recon,
const unsigned char *  scanline,
const unsigned char *  precon,
size_t  bytewidth,
unsigned char  filterType,
size_t  length 
)
static

Definition at line 4175 of file lodepng.cpp.

4176  {
4177  /*
4178  For PNG filter method 0
4179  unfilter a PNG image scanline by scanline. when the pixels are smaller than 1 byte,
4180  the filter works byte per byte (bytewidth = 1)
4181  precon is the previous unfiltered scanline, recon the result, scanline the current one
4182  the incoming scanlines do NOT include the filtertype byte, that one is given in the parameter filterType instead
4183  recon and scanline MAY be the same memory address! precon must be disjoint.
4184  */
4185 
4186  size_t i;
4187  switch (filterType) {
4188  case 0:
4189  for (i = 0; i != length; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i];
4190  break;
4191  case 1:
4192  for (i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i];
4193  for (i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i] + recon[i - bytewidth];
4194  break;
4195  case 2:
4196  if (precon) {
4197  for (i = 0; i != length; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i] + precon[i];
4198  }
4199  else {
4200  for (i = 0; i != length; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i];
4201  }
4202  break;
4203  case 3:
4204  if (precon) {
4205  for (i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i] + (precon[i] >> 1u);
4206  for (i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i] + ((recon[i - bytewidth] + precon[i]) >> 1u);
4207  }
4208  else {
4209  for (i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i];
4210  for (i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) recon[i] = scanline[i] + (recon[i - bytewidth] >> 1u);
4211  }
4212  break;
4213  case 4:
4214  if (precon) {
4215  for (i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) {
4216  recon[i] = (scanline[i] + precon[i]); /*paethPredictor(0, precon[i], 0) is always precon[i]*/
4217  }
4218 
4219  /* Unroll independent paths of the paeth predictor. A 6x and 8x version would also be possible but that
4220  adds too much code. Whether this actually speeds anything up at all depends on compiler and settings. */
4221  if (bytewidth >= 4) {
4222  for (; i + 3 < length; i += 4) {
4223  size_t j = i - bytewidth;
4224  unsigned char s0 = scanline[i + 0], s1 = scanline[i + 1], s2 = scanline[i + 2], s3 = scanline[i + 3];
4225  unsigned char r0 = recon[j + 0], r1 = recon[j + 1], r2 = recon[j + 2], r3 = recon[j + 3];
4226  unsigned char p0 = precon[i + 0], p1 = precon[i + 1], p2 = precon[i + 2], p3 = precon[i + 3];
4227  unsigned char q0 = precon[j + 0], q1 = precon[j + 1], q2 = precon[j + 2], q3 = precon[j + 3];
4228  recon[i + 0] = s0 + paethPredictor(r0, p0, q0);
4229  recon[i + 1] = s1 + paethPredictor(r1, p1, q1);
4230  recon[i + 2] = s2 + paethPredictor(r2, p2, q2);
4231  recon[i + 3] = s3 + paethPredictor(r3, p3, q3);
4232  }
4233  }
4234  else if (bytewidth >= 3) {
4235  for (; i + 2 < length; i += 3) {
4236  size_t j = i - bytewidth;
4237  unsigned char s0 = scanline[i + 0], s1 = scanline[i + 1], s2 = scanline[i + 2];
4238  unsigned char r0 = recon[j + 0], r1 = recon[j + 1], r2 = recon[j + 2];
4239  unsigned char p0 = precon[i + 0], p1 = precon[i + 1], p2 = precon[i + 2];
4240  unsigned char q0 = precon[j + 0], q1 = precon[j + 1], q2 = precon[j + 2];
4241  recon[i + 0] = s0 + paethPredictor(r0, p0, q0);
4242  recon[i + 1] = s1 + paethPredictor(r1, p1, q1);
4243  recon[i + 2] = s2 + paethPredictor(r2, p2, q2);
4244  }
4245  }
4246  else if (bytewidth >= 2) {
4247  for (; i + 1 < length; i += 2) {
4248  size_t j = i - bytewidth;
4249  unsigned char s0 = scanline[i + 0], s1 = scanline[i + 1];
4250  unsigned char r0 = recon[j + 0], r1 = recon[j + 1];
4251  unsigned char p0 = precon[i + 0], p1 = precon[i + 1];
4252  unsigned char q0 = precon[j + 0], q1 = precon[j + 1];
4253  recon[i + 0] = s0 + paethPredictor(r0, p0, q0);
4254  recon[i + 1] = s1 + paethPredictor(r1, p1, q1);
4255  }
4256  }
4257 
4258  for (; i != length; ++i) {
4259  recon[i] = (scanline[i] + paethPredictor(recon[i - bytewidth], precon[i], precon[i - bytewidth]));
4260  }
4261  }
4262  else {
4263  for (i = 0; i != bytewidth; ++i) {
4264  recon[i] = scanline[i];
4265  }
4266  for (i = bytewidth; i < length; ++i) {
4267  /*paethPredictor(recon[i - bytewidth], 0, 0) is always recon[i - bytewidth]*/
4268  recon[i] = (scanline[i] + recon[i - bytewidth]);
4269  }
4270  }
4271  break;
4272  default: return 36; /*error: invalid filter type given*/
4273  }
4274  return 0;
4275 }

◆ update_adler32()

static unsigned update_adler32 ( unsigned  adler,
const unsigned char *  data,
unsigned  len 
)

Definition at line 2165 of file lodepng.cpp.

2165  {
2166  unsigned s1 = adler & 0xffffu;
2167  unsigned s2 = (adler >> 16u) & 0xffffu;
2168 
2169  while (len != 0u) {
2170  unsigned i;
2171  /*at least 5552 sums can be done before the sums overflow, saving a lot of module divisions*/
2172  unsigned amount = len > 5552u ? 5552u : len;
2173  len -= amount;
2174  for (i = 0; i != amount; ++i) {
2175  s1 += (*data++);
2176  s2 += s1;
2177  }
2178  s1 %= 65521u;
2179  s2 %= 65521u;
2180  }
2181 
2182  return (s2 << 16u) | s1;
2183 }

Definition at line 445 of file lodepng.cpp.

445  {
446  size_t i;
447  for (i = 0; i != nbits; ++i) {
448  /* TODO: increase output size only once here rather than in each WRITEBIT */
449  WRITEBIT(writer, (unsigned char)((value >> (nbits - 1u - i)) & 1u));
450  }
451 }

)

1801  {
1802  size_t i = 0;
1803  for (i = 0; i != lz77_encoded->size; ++i) {
1804  unsigned val = lz77_encoded->data[i];
1805  writeBitsReversed(writer, tree_ll->codes[val], tree_ll->lengths[val]);
1806  if (val > 256) /*for a length code, 3 more things have to be added*/ {
1807  unsigned length_index = val - FIRST_LENGTH_CODE_INDEX;
1808  unsigned n_length_extra_bits = LENGTHEXTRA[length_index];
1809  unsigned length_extra_bits = lz77_encoded->data[++i];
1810 
1811  unsigned distance_code = lz77_encoded->data[++i];
1812 
1813  unsigned distance_index = distance_code;
1814  unsigned n_distance_extra_bits = DISTANCEEXTRA[distance_index];
1815  unsigned distance_extra_bits = lz77_encoded->data[++i];
1816 
1817  writeBits(writer, length_extra_bits, n_length_extra_bits);
1818  writeBitsReversed(writer, tree_d->codes[distance_code], tree_d->lengths[distance_code]);
1819  writeBits(writer, distance_extra_bits, n_distance_extra_bits);
1820  }
1821  }
1822 }
